EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_BgpPeer
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the BgpPeer area.

EntityDef.name: bgpPeerInTotalMessages
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of BGP messages received from the remote peer on this connection.

EntityDef.name: bgpPeerOutTotalMessages
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of BGP messages transmitted to the remote peer on this connection.

EntityDef.name: bgpPeerOutUpdates
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #BGP# UPDATE messages transmitted on this connection.

EntityDef.name: bgpPeerFsmEstablishedTransitions
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of times the #BGP# #FSM# is transitioned into the established state.

EntityDef.name: bgpPeerInUpdateElapsedTime
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the elapsed time, in seconds, since the last #BGP# UPDATE message was received from the peer. Each time the bgpPeerInUpdates counter is incremented the value of this object is set to zero.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: A network failure might have occured in the network. Investigate if there are any problems with the #IP# connectivity at the interface board.

EntityDef.name: bgpPeerInUpdates
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #BGP# UPDATE messages received on this connection.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_BSSGP_Nse
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the BSSGP_GbIpNse area.

EntityDef.name: bssgpUplinkOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of uplink #BSSGP# octets per #NSE#.

EntityDef.name: bssgpStatusBvcUnknown
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of unknown #BVC# BSSGP-STATUS messages sent to the #BSC#. These messages are sent to the #BSC# when traffic, that is BSSGP-UL-UNITDATA messages, are received on the #PTP BVC#s that do not exist in the #SGSN-MME#. The traffic is then discarded. The #PTP BVC#s are non-existent in the #SGSN-MME# since no BVC-RESET messages, for the #PTP BVC#, have been received from the #BSC#.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: Check the configuration. If no #PTP BVC# exists for incoming traffic it is probably because no BVC-RESET is received.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of downlink #BSSGP# octets per #NSE#.

EntityDef.name: bssgpUplinkPacketsSignalling
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of uplink #BSSGP# signalling packets per #NSE#.

EntityDef.name: bssgpUplinkPackets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of uplink #BSSGP# packets per #NSE#.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkPacketsSignalling
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of downlink #BSSGP# signalling packets per #NSE#.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkPackets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of downlink #BSSGP# packets per #NSE#.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_BSSGP
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the BSSGP area.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkPacketsBuff
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of IP packets buffered. It is updated when downlink payload is buffered.

EntityDef.name: bssgpSgsnInitiatePtpBvcReset
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of outgoing PTP BVC-RESET PDUs sent by the SGSN.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkPacketsDiscardLlcSuspendedEdrx
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of IP packets discarded due to suspended Logical Link Control (LLC) between MS and SGSN for MS in Extended Idle Mode Discontinuous Reception (eDRX) mode. This measurement is a subset of the measurement from the counter bssgpDownlinkPacketsDiscardLlcSuspended.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkPacketsBuffSnapshot
EntityDef.description: This measurement is a snapshot of the number of IP packets currently being buffered. It is increased when bssgp.DownlinkPacketsBuff is stepped and decreased when a packet is removed from the buffer regardless if the packet is sent or discarded.

EntityDef.name: bssgpModifyBssPfc
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of incoming MODIFY-BSS-PFC PDUs sent by the BSS.

EntityDef.name: bssgpRadioStatus
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of incoming RADIO-STATUS PDUs sent by the BSS.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownloadBssPfc
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of incoming DOWNLOAD-BSS-PFC PDUs sent by the BSS.

EntityDef.name: bssgpBssInitiateSignalingBvcReset
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of incoming signaling BVC-RESET PDUs sent by the BSS.

EntityDef.name: bssgpFlowControlBvc
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of incoming Flow-Control-BVC PDUs sent by the BSS.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkPacketsBuffLlcSuspend
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of IP packets buffered due to suspended Logical Link Control (LLC) between MS and SGSN.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkPacketsDiscardLlcSuspendedPsm
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of IP packets discarded due to suspended Logical Link Control (LLC) between MS and SGSN for MS in Power Saving Mode (PSM). This measurement is a subset of the measurement from the counter bssgpDownlinkPacketsDiscardLlcSuspended.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkPacketsBuffLlcSuspendedEdrx
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of IP packets buffered due to suspended Logical Link Control (LLC) between MS and SGSN for MS in Extended Idle Mode Discontinuous Reception (eDRX) mode. This measurement is a subset of the measurement from the counter bssgpDownlinkPacketsBuffLlcSuspend.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkPacketsDiscardLlcSuspended
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of IP packets discarded due to suspended Logical Link Control (LLC) between MS and SGSN.

EntityDef.name: bssgpBssInitiatePtpBvcReset
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of incoming PTP BVC-RESET PDUs sent by the BSS.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkPacketsDiscardedMobileSuspend
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of discarded IP packets due to suspended mobile. This counter is increased when it is the MS that has suspended GPRS.

EntityDef.name: bssgpAttSuspendProc
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted #BSSGP# suspend procedures.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkPacketsBuffMobileSuspend
EntityDef.description: This counter will be increased when buffering packets and the last reason for delay was the MS that has suspended GPRS.

EntityDef.name: bssgpAttResumeProc
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted #BSSGP# resume procedures.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkPacketsDiscardedBvcBlocked
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of discarded packets due to blocked BVCs. The counter is increased when a packet is discarded and the BSS has blocked a cell.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkPacketsBuffBucketFull
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of IP packets being buffered due to flow control. This counter is increased when buffering IP packets and the BSS Cell bucket is full; the BSS MS bucket is full and when the BSS PFC bucket is full.

EntityDef.name: bssgpFlowControlPfc
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of incoming Flow-Control-PFC PDUs sent by the BSS.

EntityDef.name: bssgpSgsnInitiateSignalingBvcReset
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of outgoing signaling BVC-RESET PDUs sent by the SGSN.

EntityDef.name: bssgpFlowControlMs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of incoming Flow-Control-MS PDUs sent by the BSS.

EntityDef.name: bssgpFlushLl
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of outgoing FLUSH-LL PDUs sent by the SGSN.

EntityDef.name: bssgpCreateBssPfc
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of outgoing CREATE-BSS-PFC PDUs sent by the SGSN.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkPacketsBuffLlcSuspendedPsm
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of IP packets buffered due to suspended Logical Link Control (LLC) between MS and SGSN for MS in Power Saving Mode (PSM). This measurement is a subset of the measurement from the counter bssgpDownlinkPacketsBuffLlcSuspend.

EntityDef.name: bssgpDownlinkPacketsDiscardedBucketFull
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of discarded IP packets due to Bucket Full. The counter is increased when the BSS Cell bucket is full, the BSS MS bucket is full, and when the BSS PFC bucket is full.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_CAMEL_G
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the CAMEL_G area.

EntityDef.name: CAM.FailDialoguesScf.G
EntityDef.description: Incremented when it explicitly indicates in the message from gsmSCF that GPRS dialogue shall be terminated. This counter does not refer to any occurrence or event on application level, that is Release GPRS.

EntityDef.name: CAM.FailDialoguesSsf.G
EntityDef.description: Incremented when 1) GPRS dialogue couldn't be established due to any reason, 2) it implicitly indicates in the message from gprsSSF that the GPRS dialogue is terminated, or, 3) gprsSSF implicitly terminates GPRS dialogue due to any internal reason (that is.resource shortage, overload protection, and so on). This counter does not refer to any occurrence or event on application level.

EntityDef.name: CAM.AttCamelDialogues.G
EntityDef.description: Total number of CAMEL dialogue attempts.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_CAMEL_U
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the CAMEL_U area.

EntityDef.name: CAM.FailDialoguesScf.U
EntityDef.description: Incremented when it explicitly indicates in the message from gsmSCF that GPRS dialogue is terminated. This counter does not refer to any occurrence or event on application level, that is Release GPRS.

EntityDef.name: CAM.AttCamelDialogues.U
EntityDef.description: Total number of #CAMEL# dialogue attempts.

EntityDef.name: CAM.FailDialoguesSsf.U
EntityDef.description: Incremented when 1) GPRS dialogue couldn't be established due to any reason, 2) it implicitly indicates in the message from gprsSSF that the GPRS dialogue is terminated, or, 3) gprsSSF implicitly terminates GPRS dialogue due to any internal reason (that is resource shortage, overload protection, and so on). This counter does not refer to any occurrence or event on application level.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_CDMA_E
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the CDMA_E area.

EntityDef.name: VS.CDMA.S102NotificationSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement shows the number of A21-Event Notification messages sent by the MME to the IWS that results in A21-Ack messages being sent back to the MME without a cause code.

EntityDef.name: VS.CDMA.S102DownlinkAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement shows the number of downlink A21-AIS tunneling messages received by the MME from the IWS.

EntityDef.name: VS.CDMA.S102DownlinkFail.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement shows the number of downlink A21-AIS messages received by the MME from the IWS that results in A21-Ack messages being sent back to the IWS with a cause code.

EntityDef.name: VS.CDMA.S1apDownlinkAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement shows the number of downlink S1 CDMA2000 messages sent by the MME to the UEs through eNodeB.

EntityDef.name: VS.CDMA.S102UplinkAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement shows the number of uplink A21-AIS messages sent by the MME to the IWS, including resendings.

EntityDef.name: VS.CDMA.S102NotificationAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement shows the number of A21-Event Notification messages sent by the MME to the IWS, including resendings.

EntityDef.name: VS.CDMA.NbrRegisteredUE.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement shows the number of UEs currently connected to an IWS that are reachable by the MME.

EntityDef.name: VS.CDMA.S1apUplinkAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement shows the number of uplink S1 CDMA2000 tunneling messages received by the MME.

EntityDef.name: VS.CDMA.S102UplinkSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement shows the number of uplink A21-AIS messages sent by the MME to the IWS that results in A21-Ack messages being sent back to the MME without a cause code.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_CDMA_MM_E
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the CDMA_MM_E area.

EntityDef.name: VS.CDMA.S102SrvccTo1xAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement shows the number of uplink A21-AIS messages for initiating SRVCC to 1xRTT procedures sent by the MME to the IWS, including resendings.

EntityDef.name: VS.CDMA.S102SrvccTo1xSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement shows the number of SRVCC to 1xRTT procedures completed by receiving UE Context Release Request with Radio Network Layer cause Redirection towards 1xRTT.

EntityDef.name: VS.CDMA.S102HoFailStatusFromIWS.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement shows the number of GCSNA messages with status Handoff failure received from the IWS during SRVCC to 1xRTT procedures.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_Charging_GTPP
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the Charging_GTPP area.

EntityDef.name: GTPP.SuccCdrTransf
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful CDR packets transferred to the CGF. It is incremented when the Data Record Transfer Response message is received from the CGF with the Cause value "Request Accepted".

EntityDef.name: GTPP.CdrTransfReq.2
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of CDR transfer requests at the GTP Prime protocol that are sent from the SGSN to the next CGF when the previous request could not be sent successfully. It is incremented when the Data Record Transfer Request message is sent with the Packet Transfer Command IE having the value "Send possible duplicated Data Record Packet".

EntityDef.name: GTPP.CdrTransfReq.1
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of CDR transfer requests at the GTP Prime protocol that are sent for the first time from the SGSN to the CGF. It is incremented when the Data Record Transfer Request message is sent with the Packet Transfer Command IE having the value "Send Data Record Packet".

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_DNS
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the DNS area.

EntityDef.name: dnsTimeouts
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of timed-out DNS queries, that is, no response is received from any DNS server.
Note: This is measured on application level. On operating system level, the BIND DNS client retransmits the DNS query multiple times before the application times out. It is also possible that the retransmission continues after the application times out. Therefore, this counter does not correlate with the number of DNS queries that are sent externally toward the configured DNS server(s).
Note: The DNS query succeeds, if the DNS record is cached in the SGSN-MME. This is because the SGSN-MME indefinitely reuses the cached record when there is a timeout, even though the time-to-live value is exceeded.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: For more information on how to troubleshoot DNS connectivity, see DNS Related Faults in Troubleshooting.
The consequences of lost DNS connectivity are as follows: - DNS queries fail if the record is not cached. This can lead to major service outage. - DNS queries succeed if the record is cached, even after the record expires (time-to-live value exceeded). - All DNS queries fail as soon as the DNS cache is cleared. The DNS cache is cleared by a restart or an operator command. - DNS server provisioning does not have any effect until the DNS connectivity is restored.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_Ethernet
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the Ethernet area.

EntityDef.name: ethInErrorsCS
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of incoming Ethernet collisions.

EntityDef.name: ethOutErrorsEC
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of outgoing excessive collisions.

EntityDef.name: ethInOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the subtotal number of successfully received bytes in Ethernet frames.

EntityDef.name: ethOutFrames
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully transmitted Ethernet frames.

EntityDef.name: ethOutErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of not transmitted outbound Ethernet frames.

EntityDef.name: ethInErrorsBUF
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of buffer allocation errors for incoming Ethernet frames.

EntityDef.name: ethOutErrorsLC
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of outgoing late collisions.

EntityDef.name: ethInErrorsTL
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of too large received Ethernet frames.

EntityDef.name: ethInErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of incoming incorrect Ethernet frames.

EntityDef.name: ethInFrames
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully received Ethernet frames.

EntityDef.name: ethOutOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of successfully transmitted bytes in Ethernet frames.

EntityDef.name: ethOutErrorsTXD
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of transmit descriptor errors when the TxD can not be created.

EntityDef.name: ethOutErrorsTO
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of outgoing transmit jabber timeouts.

EntityDef.name: ethInErrorsCE
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of incoming bad #CRC# Ethernet frames.

EntityDef.name: ethInErrorsRF
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of incoming Ethernet frames that are damaged by collision.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_GRETunnel
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the GRETunnel area.

EntityDef.name: greTaPacketsNotOk
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of incorrect packets processed associated with the current #TA#.
Note: This counter is now deprecated.

EntityDef.name: greTaPacketsOk
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of correct packets processed associated with the current #TA#.
Note: This counter is now deprecated.

EntityDef.name: greTaCurrentBytes
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of bytes transferred including the tunnel overhead.
Note: This counter is now deprecated.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_OverloadProtection_MM
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the OverloadProtection_MM area.

EntityDef.name: gsnOverloadProtectionIgnoredOutboundRequestsHSS
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of outgoing request messages toward the HSS that have been rejected by the outbound overload protection mechanism.

EntityDef.name: gsnOverloadProtectionIgnoredOutboundRequestsGTPC
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of outgoing GTP-C request messages that have been rejected by the outbound overload protection mechanism.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.OverloadProtectionDiscardedPagingMessage.E
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of #S1AP# paging messages that have been discarded by the #SCTP# paging overload protection mechanism in order to avoid a potential overload of the SS7/SCTP DPs. Note that as long as the #CPU# load is not extremely high only a subset of the paging messages is discarded, and hence the paging procedure does not necessarily fail. Outgoing paging messages related to CS Fallback to WCDMA and GSM are not discarded by the #OLP# mechanism. Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: This is an indication of overload and it is time to offload the #SGSN-MME#, for example, by moving one or more eNodeBs to a less loaded #SGSN-MME#. If several paging messages are ignored, this could be an indication that it is time to reconfigure the network.
The alarm is cleared when the overload situation has ceased. For more information, see Troubleshooting.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_OverloadProtection_Ss7OlpPriority
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the OverloadProtection_Ss7OlpPriority area.The overload protection priority as given by primitives from the MAP, CAP, BSSAP+ or RANAP layers. (1 = highest priority and 5 = lowest priority.)

EntityDef.name: gsnOverloadProtectionSs7MessageReject
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of rejected outgoing request through #SS7# link. The counter is incremented when an outgoing request through #SS7# link is rejected. #SCCP# messages are discarded. #TCAP# messages are rejected with a reject message.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: This is an indication of #SS7# overload. The #SS7# bandwidth may need to be increased or the Ss7EffectiveBandwidth parameter may need to be adjusted to match available #SS7# bandwidth.
#SS7# overload may also occur after an #SGSN-MME# restart or a large restart, and the reattach rate may be so high that the system temporarily needs to reject #SS7# traffic to protect #SS7# links from overload. The alarm will be cleared as more and more subscribers are successfully attached in the #SGSN-MME# which results in decreased load on the #SS7# links. For more information, see Troubleshooting.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_OverloadProtection_E_PIU
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the OverloadProtection_E_PIU area.

EntityDef.name: gsnOverloadProtectionRefusedS1ApRequest
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of refused incoming S1AP requests. The counter is incremented when an incoming request is subject to OLP for the S1-MME interface. This will for example lead to failed Attach, Detach, Service Request or TAU. The OLP for the S1-MME interface is active on the SCTP devices.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold:
This is an indication of signaling overload in SGSN-MME. Consider reviewing the network dimensioning/configuration.
Note that the overload could be due to a temporary error in the network. Examples of this could be SGSN-MME restart, large restart or an eNodeB restart. It may also occur during temporary external communication problems towards for example the HSS, when causing the mobiles to retry their signaling (mainly attach) in a large scale. In this case the signaling rate may be so high that the system temporarily needs to ignore it to protect the APs from overload. The alarm will be cleared as more and more subscribers are successfully attached and/or have successfully finished their signaling towards the SGSN-MME, which results in decreased signaling load. If the reason for the alarm is temporary and well known, no actions need to be taken. For further details see Troubleshooting.
Moving one or more BSCs or RNCs (SGSN-MME deployment dependent) may also improve the situation, due to the fact that if the SGSN-MME is heavily loaded from the GSM or WCDMA side it affects the total load on the SGSN-MME, thus may decrease the signaling success on the LTE side also. When this alarm is raised and not cleared within a limited period of time, it could be an indication that it is time to reconfigure the network.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_OverloadProtection_ApOlpPriority
gsnOverloadProtectionIgnoredConnections
EntityDef.description:
This indexed measurement shows the number of messages discarded by the Application Processor OverLoad Protection (AP OLP). The index is the AP OLP Priority level assigned to the UE. The AP OLP mechanism discards messages based on OLP Priority levels.
There are two other measurements related to this measurement. These are:
- gsnOverloadProtectionIgnoredExistingConnections which provides the number of discarded messages for UE having an existing connection, that is, a connection known by the MME. This measurement is independent of the OLP Priority level and is overlapping the measurement gsnOverloadProtectionIgnoredConnections.
- gsnOverloadProtectionIgnoredNewConnections which provides the number of discarded messages for UE that does not have an existing connection, that is, a connection unknown to the MME. This measurement is independent of the OLP Priority level and overlaps the measurement gsnOverloadProtectionIgnoredConnections.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_OverloadProtection
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the OverloadProtection area.

EntityDef.name: gsnOverloadProtectionCPUIgnoredConnections
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of discarded messages related to connections on the #AP#s due to high #CPU# or #SU# load. The counter is incremented when a message is discarded on an #AP#. An ignored request forces the initiator to resend the message.

EntityDef.name: gsnOverloadProtectionRejectedDueToDoicS6a
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of rejected messages through S6a interface towards a remote node (HSS) due to an overload indication received from this remote node. The remote node defines the percentage of all incoming messages to be dropped. The counter is incremented when a message is rejected to satisfy the requested percentage. The alarm is cleared when the overload situation has subsided. For more information, see Overload Protection.

EntityDef.name: gsnOverloadProtectionMemoryIgnoredConnections
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of discarded messages related to connections on the #AP#s due to high memory load. The counter is incremented when a message is discarded on an #AP#. An ignored request forces the initiator to resend the message.

EntityDef.name: gsnOverloadProtectionRejectedDueToDoicT6a
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of rejected messages through T6a interface towards a remote node (SCEF) due to an overload indication received from this remote node. The remote node defines the percentage of all incoming messages to be dropped. The counter is incremented when a message is rejected to satisfy the requested percentage. The alarm is cleared when the overload situation has subsided. For more information, see Overload Protection.

EntityDef.name: gsnOverloadProtectionQueueIgnoredConnections
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of discarded messages related to connections on the #AP#s due to high queue length on certain processes. The counter is incremented when a message is discarded on an #AP#. An ignored request forces the initiator to resend the message.

EntityDef.name: gsnOverloadProtectionIgnoredExistingConnections
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of discarded messages related to connections on the #AP#s. The counter is incremented when a request to an existing connection is discarded on an #AP#. An existing connection is a connection where the #MS#/#UE# is known in the #SGSN-MME#, but is currently not doing any control signaling. A discarded request forces the initiator to resend the message.
Three factors can cause the request to be discarded on the #AP#s. These are:
- high #CPU# or Scheduler Utilization (#SU#) load, - high memory usage or, - long queues.
High #CPU# load is visible in the #CPU# counters or detected internally in the #SGSN-MME# as long queue length to certain processes. Long queues can occur even if the #CPU# counter is not high, especially if the signaling comes in bursts.
There are three counters used for measuring the number of discarded messages for each attribute listed above. These are:
- gsnOverloadProtectionCPUIgnoredConnections, - gsnOverloadProtectionMemoryIgnoredConnections, - gsnOverloadProtectionQueueIgnoredConnections.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold:
- There is an indication of overload and the #SGSN-MME# must be offloaded by, for example, moving one or more #BSC#s, #RNC#s, or eNodeBs to a less loaded #SGSN-MME#. The threshold for this measurement type indicates a severe overload condition on the #SGSN-MME#.
- Overload can also occur after an #SGSN-MME# restart or recovery situation after a SW or HW fault. In this case the signaling rate can be so high that the system temporarily needs to reject signaling to protect the local #AP# from overload. It can also happen after restarts of external nodes when the #SGSN-MME# needs to take immediate action, such as eNodeB restart or #HLR#/#HSS# restart, or when external nodes regain connectivity, which can increase signaling due to resending information in the network.
The alarm is cleared when the overload situation has ceased. For more information, see Troubleshooting.

EntityDef.name: gsnOverloadProtectionIgnoredNewConnections
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of messages related to connections on the #AP#s. The counter is incremented when a request to a new connection is discarded on an #AP#. A new connection is a connection where the #MS#/#UE# is unknown in the #SGSN-MME#. A discarded request will lead to, for example, a failed attach or #ISRAU#.
Three factors can cause the request to be discarded on the #AP#s. These are:
- high #CPU# or Scheduler Utilization (#SU#) load, - high memory usage or, - long queues.
High #CPU# load is visible in the #CPU# counters or detected internally in the #SGSN-MME# as long queue length to certain processes. Long queues can occur when the #CPU# counter is not high, especially if the signaling comes in bursts.
The request can also be discarded due to lack of memory on a payload #DP#. The limit is set either by the #AP# handling the connection, or by the payload #DP# with the least free memory.
There are three counters used for measuring the number of discarded messages for each attribute listed above. These are:
- gnsOverloadProtectionCPUIgnoredConnections, - gnsOverloadProtectionMemoryIgnoredConnections, - gnsOverloadProtectionQueueIgnoredConnections.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold:
- There is an indication of overload and the #SGSN-MME# must be offloaded by, for example, moving one or more #BSC#s, #RNC#s, or eNodeBs to an #SGSN-MME# with less load. If several new connections are ignored, then a network reconfiguration could be necessary. The threshold for ignored new connections is lower than for existing connections.
- Overload can also occur after an #SGSN-MME# restart or recovery situation after a SW or HW fault. In this case, the signaling rate can be so high that the system temporarily needs to reject signaling to protect the local #AP# from overload. It can also happen after restarts of external nodes when the #SGSN-MME# needs to take immediate action, such as eNodeB restart or #HLR#/#HSS# restart, or when external nodes regain connectivity, which can increase signaling due to resending information in the network.
The alarm is cleared when the overload situation has ceased. For more information, see Troubleshooting.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_OverloadProtection_U_PIU
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the OverloadProtection_U_PIU area.

EntityDef.name: gsnOverloadProtectionRefusedSccpConnectReq
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of refused incoming #SCCP# connection requests. The counter is incremented when an incoming request is subject to the #SS7# #OLP# for Incoming Traffic. This will lead to failed Attach, Detach, Service Request or #RAU#. The #SS7# #OLP# for incoming traffic is active on the #SS7# devices.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: This is an indication of signaling overload in #SGSN-MME#. It may be time to offload the #SGSN-MME#, for example by moving one or more #RNC#s to an #SGSN-MME# with less signaling load. This alarm is raised only for connection oriented #SCCP# signaling for #WCDMA#. However moving one or more #BSC#s may also improve the situation, due to the fact that if the #SGSN-MME# is heavily loaded from the #GSM# side it affects the total load on the #SGSN-MME#, thus may decrease the signaling success on the #WCDMA# side also. When this alarm is raised and not cleared within a limited period of time, it could be an indication that it is time to reconfigure the network. Overload may also occur after a #SGSN-MME# restart, large restart or an #RNC# restart. It may also occur during temporary external communication problems towards for example the #HLR#, when causing the mobiles to retry their signaling (mainly attach) in a large scale. In this case the signaling rate may be so high that the system temporarily needs to ignore it to protect the #AP#s from overload. The alarm will be cleared as more and more subscribers are successfully attached and/or have successfully finished their signaling towards the #SGSN-MME#, which results in decreased signaling load. If the reason for the alarm is temporary and well known, no actions need to be taken. For further details see Troubleshooting.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_GTPControlPlane
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types related to the GTP User Plane area. The measurement types were placed in the SGSN-MME_GTPControlPlane group by mistake and may be moved to the SGSN-MME_GTPUserPlane group in a later release.

EntityDef.name: GTP.InDataPktGn
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #GTP# data #PDUs# which have been accepted and processed by the #GTP# entity on the Gn interface. Note that the counter includes the total number of #GTP# packets sent, regardless of the #GTP# version.

EntityDef.name: GTP.OutDataPktS4
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #GTP# data #PDU#s which have been generated by the #GTP# protocol entity on the S4 interface. #Note: The counter includes the total number of #GTP# packets sent, regardless of the #GTP# version.Note#

EntityDef.name: GTP.PayloadgtpuErrorPkt
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of incoming #GTP# data packets where payload length indicated in #GTP# header is inconsistent with actual length. The #SGSN# receives a #GTP-U# packet from either the #RNC# or the #GGSN# and detects that the payload length indicated in the #GTP# header is inconsistent with the actual length. The counter includes the total number of #GTP# packets sent, regardless of the #GTP# version.

EntityDef.name: GTP.OutDataPktGn
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #GTP# data #PDUs# which have been generated by the #GTP# protocol entity on the Gn interface. Note that the counter includes the total number of #GTP# packets sent, regardless of the #GTP# version.

EntityDef.name: GTP.OutDataOctGn
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets in outgoing #GTP# data packets on the Gn interface without the #GTP# header. Note that the counter includes the total number of #GTP# packets sent, regardless of the #GTP# version. While the counter counts octets, the measurement unit of reported value is KOctets (1024 octets).

EntityDef.name: GTP.InDataOctS4
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets in incoming #GTP# data packets on the S4 interface. #Note: The counter includes the total number of #GTP# packets sent, regardless of the #GTP# version. While the counter counts octets, the measurement unit of reported value is KOctets (1024 octets).Note#

EntityDef.name: GTP.InDataOctGn
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets in incoming #GTP# data packets on the Gn interface without the #GTP# header. Note that the counter includes the total number of #GTP# packets sent, regardless of the #GTP# version. While the counter counts octets, the measurement unit of reported value is KOctets (1024 octets).

EntityDef.name: GTP.OutDataOctS4
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets in outgoing #GTP# data packets on the S4 interface. #Note: The counter includes the total number of #GTP# packets sent, regardless of the #GTP# version. While the counter counts octets, the measurement unit of reported value is KOctets (1024 octets).Note#

EntityDef.name: GTP.InDataPktS4
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #GTP# data #PDU#s which have been accepted and processed by the #GTP# entity on the S4 interface. #Note: The counter includes the total number of #GTP# packets sent, regardless of the #GTP# version.Note#

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_GTPUserPlane
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the GTPUserPlane area.

EntityDef.name: GTP.GtpuOutDataPktIu
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #GTP# data #PDUs# which have been generated by the #GTP-U# protocol entity on the Iu interface.

EntityDef.name: GTP.MBMSOutDataPktIu
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of MBMS bearer context #GTP# data #PDUs# which have been generated by the #GTP-U# protocol entity on the Iu interface.

EntityDef.name: GTP.TotalDownlinkPacketsBuff.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of IP packets buffered.

EntityDef.name: GTP.MBMSInDataPktGn
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #GTP# data #PDUs# for MBMS bearer contexts which have been accepted and processed by the #GTP# entity on the Gn interface.

EntityDef.name: GTP.GtpuInDataPktIu
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #GTP# data #PDUs# which have been accepted and processed by the #GTP-U# protocol entity on the Iu interface.

EntityDef.name: GTP.DownlinkPacketsBuff.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement is a snapshot of the number of #IP# packets currently being buffered in downlink direction. It is increased when downlink payload is buffered and decreased when packet leaves the buffer.

EntityDef.name: GTP.GtpuInDataOctIu
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the byte number of incoming data packets on the Iu interface without the #GTP-U# header. Note that while the counter counts octets, the measurement unit of reported value is KOctets (1024 octets).

EntityDef.name: GTP.GtpuOutDataOctIu
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the byte number of outgoing data packets on the Iu interface without the #GTP-U# header. Note that while the counter counts octets, the measurement unit of reported value is KOctets (1024 octets).

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_GeographicallyRedundantPool_PIU
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the GeographicallyRedundantPool_PIU area.

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.NbrofUeBackups.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of UE geo-replicas on each AP in the Replication-MME.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_GeographicallyRedundantPool
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the GeographicallyRedundantPool area.

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.PagingAvoidedDueToUeInEdrx.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of paging procedures in EPS that have been avoided due to the UE being in eDRX during UE restoration upon the DDN with IMSI procedure or CS Service Restoration or Mobile-Terminated Non-IP Data Delivery over the SCEF in Geographically redundant pool. The counter is increased when paging is needed, but cannot be performed since the UE is in eDRX and not in paging time window.

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.UeBackupRetrievalSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful UE geo-replica retrievals. This counter is incremented when the new MME trying to restore the UE service receives the successful Echo Response message over the S10 interface with the operation code "Retrieval Response".

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.UeBackupRetrievalAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of UE geo-replica retrieval attempts. This counter is incremented when the new MME trying to restore the UE service sends one or multiple Echo Request messages over the S10 interface with the operation code "Retrieval Request". The multiple retrieval messages are counted as one attempt.

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.UeBackupCreateRecd.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of UE geo-replica creation messages received. This counter is incremented each time the Replication MME receives an Echo Request message over the S10 interface with the operation code "Backup Required".

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.AttPagingForNTSR.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted PS paging procedures initiated by the MME for Network Triggered Service Restoration (NTSR). The counter is incremented when a PS paging procedure is started upon receipt of the Downlink Data Notification message from the SGW with IMSI. The counter is incremented at the sending of the paging message with the current S-TMSI in the procedure. Paging attempts for low-complexity UEs are also included.

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.DdnImsiAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of the received Downlink Data Notification (DDN) messages with IMSI. This counter is incremented each time a DDN message with IMSI is received from the SGW.

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.S6aBlockByThrottle.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of S6a messages blocked due to the Attach Throttling function in the geographically redundant pool. The counter is incremented when an S6a message is blocked because the number of messages under throttling control exceeds the available allowance. The available allowance for Geographically Redundant UE Restoration messages is the difference between the total Attach throttle allowance, specified by the MMEAttachThrottlingAttachRateLimit parameter and the reserved allowance for E-UTRAN attach procedures, specified by the MMEAttachThrottlingReservedLimitAttach parameter.

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.UeBackupDeleteRecd.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of UE geo-replica deletion messages received. This counter is incremented each time the Replication MME receives an Echo Request message over the S10 interface with the operation code "Delete Required".

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.DdnImsiSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Downlink Data Notification Acknowledge with IMSI. This counter is incremented each time a Downlink Data Notification Acknowledge message with IMSI and the cause "Request accepted" is sent out.

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.SgsPagingRelayRecd.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Echo Request messages with the "SGs Paging Request" operation code received over the S10 interface. This counter is incremented each time the MME receives an Echo Request message with the "SGs Paging Request" operation code over the S10 interface.

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.UeBackupCreateSent.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of UE geo-replica creation messages sent . This counter is incremented each time the Serving MME sends Echo Request message over the S10 interface with the operation code "Backup Required".

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.UeBackupDeleteSent.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of UE geo-replica deletion messages sent. This counter is incremented each time the Serving MME sends Echo Request message over the S10 interface with the operation code "Delete Required".

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.AttPagingForTDR.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted PS paging procedures initiated by the MME for UE restoration upon Mobile-Terminated Non-IP Data Delivery over the SCEF. The counter is incremented each time the MME initiates a PS paging procedure when receiving an MT-Data-Request message from the SCEF. Paging attempts for low-complexity UEs are also included in this measurement.

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.SgsPagingRelaySent.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Echo Request messages with the "SGs Paging Request" operation code sent over the S10 interface. This counter is incremented each time the MME sends an Echo Request message with the "SGs Paging Request" operation code over the S10 interface.

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.AttPagingForCSSR.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted PS paging procedures initiated by the MME for MSC Triggered CS Service Restoration (CSSR). The counter is incremented when a PS paging procedure is started after UE Backup Retrieval procedure upon receipt of the SGsAP Paging Request message from the MSC with IMSI. It could happen after the serving MME is restarted and the UE CS/PS service has not been restored on the MME, or the SGsAP Paging Request is sent to an alternative MME in the pool. The counter is incremented at the sending of the paging message with the current S-TMSI in the procedure.

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.AttachThrottlingNonReservedGranted.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Update Location Request (ULR) and Authentication Information Request (AIR) messages due to the UE Restoration procedure that have been accepted by the Attach throttle using the non-reserved allowance. The non-reserved allowance is the difference between the total Attach throttle allowance, specified by the MMEAttachThrottlingAttachRateLimit parameter, and the sum of the reserved allowances, specified by the MMEAttachThrottlingReservedLimitAttach and MMEAttachThrottlingReservedLimitGeoredRestore parameters. ULR and AIR messages accepted using the reserved Geored allowance specified by the MMEAttachThrottlingReservedLimitGeoredRestore parameter are not counted.

EntityDef.name: VS.GeoRed.UeBackupRetrievalSent.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of all Retrieval messages sent by the new MME. This counter is incremented each time the new MME sends an Echo Request message over the S10 interface with the operation code "Retrieval Request". For one UE geo-replica retrieval attempt, multiple retrieval messages may be sent to different MMEs in the pool and they are all counted.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_ICMP_RouterInstance
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the ICMP_RouterInstance area. The icmpOut measurements are not applicable if MkVIII HW forwarding is enabled.

EntityDef.name: icmpOutParmProbs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Parameter Problem messages sent from the indexed logical network.

EntityDef.name: icmpOutTimeExcds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Time Exceeded messages sent from the indexed logical network.

EntityDef.name: icmpOutDestUnreachs
EntityDef.description: "This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Destination Unreachable messages sent from the indexed logical network.

EntityDef.name: icmpOutErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# messages not sent by all logical networks on this entity. This due to #ICMP# error messages not sent as the result of receiving erroneous #ICMP# error messages or to problems discovered within #ICMP#, such as lack of buffers. The value does not include errors discovered outside the #ICMP# layer such as the inability of #IP# to route the resultant datagram.

EntityDef.name: icmpInDestUnreachs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Destination Unreachable messages received on the indexed logical network.

EntityDef.name: icmpInParmProbs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Parameter Problem messages received on the indexed logical network.

EntityDef.name: icmpInMsgs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# messages, received on the indexed logical network. Note that this counter also includes some of the messages counted by the icmpInErrors counter, such as bad code and bad length messages.

EntityDef.name: icmpOutEchoReps
EntityDef.description: "This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Echo Reply messages sent from the indexed logical network.

EntityDef.name: icmpInTimeExcds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Time Exceeded messages received on the indexed logical network.

EntityDef.name: icmpInErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# messages which the indexed logical network received but determined as having #ICMP#-specific errors (bad #ICMP# checksums, bad length, and so on).

EntityDef.name: icmpInRedirects
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Redirect messages received on the indexed logical network.

EntityDef.name: icmpInEchoReps
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Echo Reply messages received on the indexed logical network.

EntityDef.name: icmpOutMsgs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of #ICMP# messages which the indexed logical network attempted to send. Note that this counter includes all messages counted by the icmpOutErrors counter.

EntityDef.name: icmpOutEchos
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Echo (request) messages sent from the indexed logical network.

EntityDef.name: icmpInEchos
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Echo (request) messages received on the indexed logical network.

EntityDef.name: icmpOutRedirects
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Redirect messages sent from the indexed logical network.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_ICMP_PIU
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the ICMP_PIU area. The icmpOut measurements are not applicable if MkVIII HW forwarding is enabled.

EntityDef.name: icmpOutTimeExcds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Time Exceeded messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpOutEchoReps
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Echo Reply messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpInEchoReps
EntityDef.description: "This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Echo Reply messages received on all logical networks located on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpOutErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# messages not sent by all logical networks on this entity. This due to #ICMP# error messages not sent as the result of receiving erroneous #ICMP# error messages or to problems discovered within #ICMP#, such as lack of buffers. The value does not include errors discovered outside the #ICMP# layer such as the inability of #IP# to route the resultant datagram.

EntityDef.name: icmpOutEchos
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Echo (request) messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpOutParmProbs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Parameter Problem messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpOutDestUnreachs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Destination Unreachable messages sent from all logical networks on this entity. The icmpOut measurements are not applicable if MkVIII HW forwarding is enabled.

EntityDef.name: icmpInErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# messages which all logical networks on the entity received but determined as having #ICMP#-specific errors (bad #ICMP# checksums, bad length, and so on).

EntityDef.name: icmpOutMsgs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of #ICMP# messages which all logical networks on this entity attempted to send ncluding all messages counted by the icmpOutErrors counter.

EntityDef.name: icmpInRedirects
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Redirect messages received on all logical networks on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpOutRedirects
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Redirect messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpInEchos
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Echo (request) messages received on all logical networks on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpInParmProbs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Parameter Problem messages received on all logical networks on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpInDestUnreachs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Destination Unreachable messages received on all logical networks on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpInTimeExcds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMP# Time Exceeded messages received on all logical networks on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpInMsgs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of #ICMP# messages received on all logical networks located on the entity. This counter also includes some of the messages counted by the icmpInErrors counter, such as bad code and bad length messages.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_ICMPv6_RouterInstance
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the ICMPv6_RouterInstance area. The icmpOut measurements are not applicable if MkVIII HW forwarding is enabled.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InNeighborAds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Neighbor Advertisement messages received on all logical networks located on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InNeighborSols
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Neighbor Solicit messages received on all logical networks located on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InDestUnreachs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Destination Unreachable messages received on all logical networks on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InRedirects
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Redirect messages received on all logical networks on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InEchoReps
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Echo Reply messages received on all logical networks located on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# messages not sent by all logical networks on this entity. This due to problems discovered within #ICMP#, such as a lack of buffers. This value should not include errors discovered outside the #ICMP# layer, such as the inability of #IP# to route the resultant datagram.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutRedirects
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Redirect messages sent from all logical networks on this entity. For a host, this object will always be zero, since hosts do not send redirects.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutParmProbs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Parameter Problem messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InParmProbs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Parameter Problem messages received on all logical networks on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutEchos
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Echo Request messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutTimeExcds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Time Exceeded messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutNeighborSols
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Neighbor Solicitation messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutRouterSols
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Router Solicitation messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InEchos
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Echo Request messages received on all logical networks on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutDestUnreachs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Destination Unreachable messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutMsgs
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of #ICMPv6# messages which all logical networks on this entity attempted to send.
Note:This measurement includes all the messages counted by the icmpv6OutErrors counter.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutRouterAds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Router Advertisement messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InPktTooBigs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Packet Too Big messages received on all logical networks located on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InTimeExcds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Time Exceeded messages received on all logical networks on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutNeighborAds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Neighbor Advertisement messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutEchoReps
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Echo Reply messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InRouterSols
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Router Solicit messages received on all logical networks located on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# messages that all logical networks on the entity received but determined as having #ICMPv6#-specific errors (bad checksums, bad length, etc.).

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InRouterAds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Router Advertisement messages received on all logical networks located on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InMsgs
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of #ICMPv6# messages that the entity received.
Note: This measurement includes all the messages counted by icmpv6InErrors.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutPktTooBigs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Packet Too Big messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_ICMPv6_PIU
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the ICMPv6_PIU area. The icmpOut measurements are not applicable if MkVIII HW forwarding is enabled.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutNeighborAds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Neighbor Advertisement messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutNeighborSols
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Neighbor Solicitation messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InTimeExcds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Time Exceeded messages received on all logical networks on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InEchoReps
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Echo Reply messages received on all logical networks located on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InDestUnreachs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Destination Unreachable messages received on all logical networks on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# messages that could not be sent by all logical networks on this entity. This due to problems discovered within #ICMP#, such as a lack of buffers. This value should not include errors discovered outside the #ICMP# layer, such as the inability of #IP# to route the resultant datagram.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutRedirects
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Redirect messages sent from all logical networks on this entity. For a host, this object will always be zero, since hosts do not send redirects.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InRouterAds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Router Advertisement messages received on all logical networks located on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutMsgs
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of #ICMPv6# messages which all logical networks on this entity attempted to send.
Note: This measurement includes all the messages counted by the icmpv6OutErrors counter.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutParmProbs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Parameter Problem messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InEchos
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Echo Request messages received on all logical networks on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutPktTooBigs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Packet Too Big messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutEchoReps
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Echo Reply messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InNeighborAds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Neighbor Advertisement messages received on all logical networks located on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InRedirects
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Redirect messages received on all logical networks on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InRouterSols
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Router Solicit messages received on all logical networks located on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InNeighborSols
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Neighbor Solicit messages received on all logical networks located on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InMsgs
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of #ICMPv6# messages that the entity received.
Note: This measurement includes all the messages counted by icmpv6InErrors.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutRouterSols
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Router Solicitation messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutTimeExcds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Time Exceeded messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# messages that all logical networks on the entity received but determined as having #ICMPv6#-specific errors (bad checksums, bad length, etc.).

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutEchos
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Echo Request messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutDestUnreachs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Destination Unreachable messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InPktTooBigs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Packet Too Big messages received on all logical networks located on the entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6OutRouterAds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Router Advertisement messages sent from all logical networks on this entity.

EntityDef.name: icmpv6InParmProbs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #ICMPv6# Parameter Problem messages received on all logical networks on the entity.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_IP_RouterInstance
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the IP_RouterInstance area. The measurements only apply to IPv4 packets on MkVIII.

EntityDef.name: ipReasmOKs
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of #IP# datagrams successfully reassembled on the indexed logical network.
This measurement is not used for payload traffic, only for traffic terminating on the router board.

EntityDef.name: ipFragCreates
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of #IP# datagram fragments that have been generated as a result of fragmentation at the indexed logical network.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and dynamic routing.

EntityDef.name: ipInHdrErrors
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of input datagrams discarded on all logical networks on this entity. This due to errors in their #IP# headers, such as version number mismatch, bad header length, bad #IP# total length. In addition, for packets designated to a router board, errors discovered in processing control flags, header checksum, and #IP# options are counted.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and dynamic routing.

EntityDef.name: ipInAddrErrors
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of input datagrams discarded on the indexed logical network, because the #IP# address in their #IP# header's destination field was not a valid address. This count includes invalid addresses (for example, 0.0.0.0) and addresses of unsupported classes (for example, Class E).
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and dynamic routing.

EntityDef.name: ipReasmFails
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of failures (for any reason) detected by the #IP# reassembly algorithm for the indexed logical network. Note that this is not necessarily a count of discarded #IP# fragments.
This measurement is not used for payload traffic, only for traffic terminating on the router board.

EntityDef.name: ipOutNoRoutes
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number #IP# datagrams discarded, on the indexed logical network, because no route could be found to transmit them to their destination. Note that this counter includes any packets counted in the ipForwDatagrams counter which meets this no-route criterion.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and dynamic routing.

EntityDef.name: ipReasmReqds
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of #IP# fragments received on the indexed logical network which needed to be reassembled at this entity.
This measurement is not used for payload traffic, only for traffic terminating on the router board.

EntityDef.name: ipFragFails
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of #IP# datagrams that have been discarded because they needed to be fragmented at the indexed logical network but could not be because, for example, their Don't Fragment flag was set.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and dynamic routing.

EntityDef.name: ipInReceives
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of input datagrams received on the indexed logical network, including those received in error.
This measurement counts IP packets that include payload, signalling, and dynamic routing packets.

EntityDef.name: ipForwDatagrams
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of input datagrams for which this entity is not the final IPv4 destination, and so an attempt is made to find a route to forward the input datagrams to the IPv4 destination.
This measurement counts IP packets that include payload, signalling, and dynamic routing packets.

EntityDef.name: ipFragOKs
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of #IP# datagrams that have been successfully fragmented at the indexed logical network.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and dynamic routing.

EntityDef.name: ipForwardingTableEntries
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv4 routes currently in the forwarding table.
The SCXB allows a maximum of 5000 IPv4 routes in the forwarding table of each IP network. Exceeding this limit causes loss of connectivity.
This measurement type is indexed by IP indexing option 2, MagId.SlotId.Network only.
Do the following when the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: - Reduce the number of static routes configured on the SGSN-MME. - Reduce the number of routes exported to the SGSN-MME from external routers. - If OSPF is used, consider using OSPF NSSA to reduce the number of routes.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_IP_PIU
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the IP_PIU area. The measurements only applies to IPv4 packets.

EntityDef.name: ipReasmReqds
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of #IP# fragments received, for all logical networks on this entity, which needed to be reassembled at this entity.
This measurement is not used for payload traffic, only for traffic terminating on the router board.

EntityDef.name: ipReasmOKs
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of #IP# datagrams successfully reassembled on all logical networks on this entity.
This measurement is not used for payload traffic, only for traffic terminating on the router board.

EntityDef.name: ipOutNoRoutes
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of #IP# datagrams discarded, on all logical networks on this entity, because no route could be found to transmit them to their destination. Note that this counter includes any packets counted in the ipForwDatagrams counter which meets this no-route criterion.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and dynamic routing.

EntityDef.name: ipFragFails
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of #IP# datagrams that have been discarded because they needed to be fragmented at logical networks on this entity but could not be because, for example, their Don't Fragment flag was set.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and dynamic routing.

EntityDef.name: ipReasmFails
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of failures (for any reason) detected by the #IP# reassembly algorithm for all logical networks on this entity. Note that this is not necessarily a count of the discarded #IP# fragments.
This measurement is not used for payload traffic, only for traffic terminating on the router board.

EntityDef.name: ipFragOKs
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of #IP# datagrams that have been successfully fragmented at all logical networks on this entity.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and dynamic routing.

EntityDef.name: ipForwTableEntriesTotal
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of IPv4 routes currently in all forwarding tables on the LC.
The SGSN-MME has the following limits on route numbers: - The SMXB supports a total maximum of 40,000 IPv4 routes in all forwarding tables of each LC. - The SMXB has no limit on the number of IPv4 routes in the forwarding table of each IP network. Exceeding these limits causes loss of connectivity.
Do the following when the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: - Reduce the number of static routes configured on the SGSN-MME. - Reduce the number of routes exported to the SGSN-MME from external routers. - If OSPF is used, consider using OSPF NSSA to reduce the number of routes.

EntityDef.name: ipForwDatagrams
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of input datagrams for which this entity is not the final IPv4 destination, and so an attempt is made to find a route to forward the input datagrams to the IPv4 destination.
This measurement counts IP packets that include payload, signalling, and dynamic routing packets.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsInDiscards
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of input IP datagrams for which no problems were encountered to prevent their continued processing, but were discarded. The reason can be a lack of buffer space, therefore no point to process further. This counter does not include any datagrams discarded while awaiting re-assembly.
Note: This measurement counts GSM payload and signalling, and WCDMA payload. It is not supported on single-access LTE nodes.

EntityDef.name: ipInAddrErrors
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of input datagrams discarded on the logical networks on this entity, because the #IP# address in their #IP# header's destination field was not a valid address. This count includes invalid addresses (for example, 0.0.0.0) and addresses of unsupported classes (for example, Class E).
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and dynamic routing.

EntityDef.name: ipInHdrErrors
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of input datagrams discarded on all logical networks on this entity. This due to errors in their #IP# headers, such as version number mismatch, bad header length, bad #IP# total length. In addition, for packets designated to a router board, errors discovered in processing control flags, header checksum, and #IP# options are counted.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and dynamic routing.

EntityDef.name: ipInReceives
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of input datagrams received from interfaces, including those received in error.
This measurement counts IP packets that include payload, signalling, and dynamic routing packets.

EntityDef.name: ipFragCreates
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of #IP# datagram fragments that have been generated as a result of fragmentation at the logical networks on this entity.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and dynamic routing.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_IPInterface
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the IPInterface area.

EntityDef.name: ifOutPkts
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested to be transmitted.
This counter is applicable to packets forwarded in Ethernet frames, which can include IPv4 packets, IPv6 packets, and ARP packets.

EntityDef.name: ifInPkts
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer.
This counter is applicable to packets forwarded in Ethernet frames, which can include IPv4 packets, IPv6 packets, and ARP packets.

EntityDef.name: ifOutQLen
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the length of the output packet queue, in packets.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: The severity of the overload depends on the queue's length (the threshold value) and the overload frequency. If the threshold is reached often, it may indicate that either the network capacity or the load sharing needs to be improved.
This counter is applicable to packets forwarded in Ethernet frames, which can include IPv4 packets, IPv6 packets, and ARP packets.

EntityDef.name: ifOutDiscards
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of packets that have been dropped due to lack of resources or denied by packet filtering. There can be a lack of resources when packet queues are full, or when the driver is out of buffers, clusters or descriptors.
This counter is applicable to packets forwarded in Ethernet frames, which can include IPv4 packets, IPv6 packets, and ARP packets.

EntityDef.name: ifInOctets
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters.
This counter is applicable to packets forwarded in Ethernet frames, which can include IPv4 packets, IPv6 packets, and ARP packets.

EntityDef.name: ifOutOctets
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.
This counter is applicable to packets forwarded in Ethernet frames, which can include IPv4 packets, IPv6 packets, and ARP packets.

EntityDef.name: ifInDiscards
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of inbound packets that have been dropped due to lack of resources or denied by packet filtering. Lack of resources can for example be when packet queues are full, the driver is out of buffers, clusters or descriptors.
This counter is applicable to packets forwarded in Ethernet frames, which can include IPv4 packets, IPv6 packets, and ARP packets.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_IPPacketFilter_PIU
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the IPPacketFilter_PIU area.

EntityDef.name: filterAllowedPacketsOnSlot
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of packets allowed by filter on this slot. This counter is now deprecated.

EntityDef.name: filterIpsecPacketsOnSlot
EntityDef.description:
Number of packets classified as #IPsec# or GRE by filter on this slot.
The counter value is only applicable for #IBAS# #IP# Interface PIUs. This counter is now deprecated.

EntityDef.name: filterDeniedPacketsOnSlot
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of packets denied by filter on this slot.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: Check the filter configuration. If that does not solve the problem, analysis of the inbound traffic may be necessary. This counter is now deprecated.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_IPPacketFilter_Connection
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the IPPacketFilter_Connection area.

EntityDef.name: filterIpsecPackets
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of packets classified as #IPsec# or #GRE# by filter for a specific interface and direction.
The counter value is only applicable for #IBAS# #IP# Interface PIUs. This counter is now deprecated.

EntityDef.name: filterAllowedPackets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of packets allowed by filter for a specific interface and direction. This counter is now deprecated.

EntityDef.name: filterDeniedPackets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of packets denied by filter for a specific interface and direction. This counter is now deprecated.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_IPsecSecurityAssociation
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the IPsecSecurityAssociation area.

EntityDef.name: ipsecSaPacketsNotOk
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of incorrect packets processed associated with the current #SA#.
Note: This counter is only applicable to MkVI and MkVI+. This counter is now deprecated.

EntityDef.name: ipsecSaPacketsOk
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of correct packets processed associated with the current #SA#.
Note: This counter is only applicable to MkVI and MkVI+. This counter is now deprecated.

EntityDef.name: ipsecSaCurrentBytes
EntityDef.description:
