EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful #EPS# Bearer Modification procedures initiated by the #MME#. The counter is incremented when the Modify #EPS# Bearer Context Accept message arrives at the #MME#.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModEpsBearerCmdAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Modify Bearer Command procedures initiated by the MME. Note: The measured data of the counter is incremented when Modify Bearer Command message is sent from the MME.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.CreateDedicatedBearerFail.68
EntityDef.description: For each Create Bearer Request message sent to the #MME#, this counter is incremented with the number of bearers, that were not activated, because the feature 'Dedicated bearers' is 'Off.' A response with cause code 68 (Service not supported) is returned to the Serving Gateway. (Please note that this counter does not affect any KPI.)

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.S1RelAbnormalRNLWithGBRBearer.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of eNodeB-initiated S1 releases for UEs with GBR bearers when the S1 release cause is a Radio Network Layer category-related cause code, except the following cause codes: - USER_INACTIVITY - INTER_RAT_REDIRECTION - CS_FALLBACK_TRIGGERED - UE_NOT_AVAILABLE_FOR_PS_SERVICE - REDIRECTION_TOWARDS_1XRTT

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.CreateDedicatedBearerAtt.E
EntityDef.description: For each Create Bearer Request message sent on S11 to the #MME#, this counter is incremented with the number of bearers included in the request. Note: The Create Bearer Request message included in the Create Session Response message sent to the MME is also taken into calculation.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ActDefaultEpsBearerAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Activate Default EPS Bearer Context Request messages. The counter is increased whenever this message is sent from the MME to the UE.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModPGWInitBearerUpdateAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Bearer Modification procedures initiated by the #PDN# Gateway. The counter is incremented when the Update Bearer Request message arrives at the #MME#. This message may contain multiple bearers, each bearer is cumulated to the counter.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.PcscfRestorationIndGWAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Modify Bearer Request messages sent by the MME to the SGW with the P-CSCF Restoration Indication flag set.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.UnsuccActBearerCC27_28.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful #EPS# Bearer Activation procedures per #MME# because of cause code 27 (Unknown or missing access point name) and cause code 28 (Unknown #PDN# address or #PDN# type). The counter is incremented in the following scenarios: - The #MME# receives a Create Session Response message with cause code 78 (Missing or unknown #APN#) from the #SGW#. - The #MME# interrogates the #DNS# resolver and there is a failure, such as name error or undefined default #APN# of the #MME#. #Note:Only default bearer procedures are counted.Note#

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.CreateDedicatedBearerFail.88
EntityDef.description: For each Create Bearer Request message sent to the #MME#, this counter is incremented with the number of bearers, that were not activated, due to that the #UE# rejects the activation attempt. A response with cause code 88 (UE refuses) is returned to the Serving Gateway.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModEpsBearerCmdSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful responses of Modify Bearer Command procedures received from SGW. Note: The measured data of the counter is incremented when Update Bearer Request message is received from SGW in response to Modify Bearer Command.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.RestorePDNConnSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Create Session Response messages with accepted cause code received from the SGW in the GW restoration procedure triggered by the S11 link failure.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.CreateDedicatedBearerEmcSucc.E
EntityDef.description: For each Create Bearer Request message sent on S11 to the #MME# for IMS emergency service, this counter is incremented with the number of successfully activated bearers included in the request.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.PcscfRestorationIndGWSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Modify Bearer Response messages received by the MME to the Modify Bearer Request messages with the P-CSCF Restoration Indication flag, excluding the Modify Bearer Response messages with cause codes explicitly indicating that the P-CSCF restoration indication has not reached the PGW.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.DdnaMessage.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Downlink Data Notification Acknowledge messages sent from the MME to the SGW. This counter is incremented when a Downlink Data Notification Acknowledge message is sent from the MME to the SGW.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.NbrActPraSessions.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of PDN Connections established with an active Presence Reporting Area (PRA) session. The gauge is incremented when a PRA session is activated for a PDN Connection. The gauge is decremented when a PRA session is deactivated or when a PDN Connection with an active PRA session is removed.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.PcscfRestUENotReach.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of HSS based P-CSCF Restoration basic mechanism procedures, during which the MME fails to send the IMS PDN deactivation and reactivation request to the UE when the UE is in the ECM_IDLE state. The counter is incremented when paging or service request fails or is aborted during HSS based P-CSCF Restoration basic mechanism procedure.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.NbrEcmConnectedDefaultBearer.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of active default EPS bearers when the UE is in the ECM_CONNECTED state. The gauge is incremented when a new default EPS bearer is activated or the UE is changed to the ECM_CONNECTED state due to mobility procedures. The gauge is decremented when a default EPS bearer is deactivated or the UE is changed to the ECM_IDLE state due to mobility procedures. #Note: The CPU may increase if the VS.SM.NbrEcmConnectedDefaultBearer.E gauge is updated frequently, which depends on the traffic model.Note#

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ActDefaultBearerEmcSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully completed default #EPS# Bearer Activation procedures towards #UE# for #IMS# emergency service.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ActDefaultBearerEmcAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted default #EPS# Bearer Activation procedures between #MME# and #UE# for #IMS# emergency service. The counter is not incremented when resending an Activate Default EPS Bearer Context Request to the #UE#.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_Session_SM_G_RA
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the Session_SM_G_RA area.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActPdpContextRa.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted primary #PDP# context activation procedures per #RA# within this SGSN. These include the static as well as the dynamic #PDP# addresses. The counter is incremented as the SGSN identifies the message as a RIL3 Activate PDP Context Request message.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccActPdpContextRa.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully completed primary #PDP# context activations per #RA# within this SGSN. For these context activations, the #GGSN# is updated successfully.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_Session_SM_G
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the Session_SM_G area.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccDeactPdpContextSgsn.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully handled #PDP# context deactivations initiated by the #SGSN#. Note that the counter is incremented according to standard and also when receiving "Delete PDP Context Response" from the #GGSN# for the cases when no "Deactivate PDP Context Response" can be received from the #MS# since no "Deactivate PDP Context Request" was sent to the #MS#. A message can handle more than one PDP context, then the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.NbrActBearer.G
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of active S4 mode PDP contexts in the GSM network, that is, the gauge is incremented in the GSM network whenever a new S4 mode PDP context mode is activated and decremented in the GSM network whenever an S4 mode PDP context is deactivated.
#Note: After a change to the #PDP# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #PDP# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 90% of the PDP capacity license limit
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 85% of the PDP capacity license limit

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccActPdpContextSgsnHome.G
EntityDef.description: Number of successful primary #PDP# Context Activation procedures per #SGSN# for home subscribers. Home subscribers are defined by the roaming status parameter during the #IMSI#-series configuration.

EntityDef.name: gprsSmSgsnUnsuccessfulActivations
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful #PDP# Context Activation procedures per #SGSN-MME#. The counter is incremented when an Activate (Secondary) #PDP# Context Reject or an SM Status message is sent as a response when an Activate (Secondary) #PDP# Context Request is unsuccessful.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: This is an indication of high activation failure rates, typically caused by misconfigured #MS#s using disallowed #APN#s. In this case the resulting cause code is 28 (Unknown #PDP# address or #PDP# type) or 33 (Requested service option not subscribed). If so, check the routines for providing #MS# configuration. #RADIUS# problems are also a common cause of high failure rates. In this case the resulting cause code is 29 (User authentication failed). The alarm can be caused by #GGSN# or #RADIUS# unavailability.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ActPdpContextApnConverted.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of APN conversions in the PDP context activation procedure for GSM.

EntityDef.name: SM.ActPdpContextRedirectToSubscribedApn.G
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of #APN# redirections to the subscribed APN per SGSN.
#Note: If the SGSN default APN included in the subscribed data is used as the negotiated APN, this counter will exclude this scenario. Note#

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActPdpContextSgsnHome.G
EntityDef.description: Number of attempted primary #PDP# Context Activation procedures per #SGSN# for home subscribers. Home subscribers are defined by the roaming status parameter during the #IMSI#-series configuration.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccModPdpContextMs.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully handled #MS#-initiated #PDP# context modifications procedures. These modifications are performed successfully when a Modify PDP Context Accept message is sent to the #MS#.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ActDefaultBearerS4Succ.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Create Session Response messages with success received from the #SGW# in the #PDP# context activation procedure for #GSM#, that is, the counter is incremented whenever a Create Session Response message is received from the #SGW# in the #PDP# context activation procedure for #GSM#.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttDeactPdpContextGgsn.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted GGSN-initiated PDP context deactivation procedures. A message can handle more than one PDP context, then the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModBearerS4Att.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Modify Bearer Request messages sent to the #SGW# in #GSM#, that is, the counter is incremented whenever a Modify Bearer Request message is sent to the #SGW# excluding the retransmission.

EntityDef.name: SM.NbrActPdpContext.G
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of active #PDP# contexts, that is, the gauge is incremented whenever a new #PDP# context is activated and decremented whenever a #PDP# context is deactivated.
#Note: After a change to the #PDP# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #PDP# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 90 % of the PDP capacity license limit
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 85 % of the PDP capacity license limit

EntityDef.name: SM.AttDeactPdpContextMs.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted MS-initiated PDP context deactivation procedures. A message can handle more than one PDP context, then the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: SM.ActPdpContextRedirectToEpsSubscribedApn.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of APN redirections to the subscribed APN of the lowest context ID when using EPS subscription data per SGSN.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccUpdPdpContextSgsn.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully handled #SGSN#-initiated #PDP# context update procedures. These updates are performed successfully when a positive update #PDP# context response is received from the #GGSN#.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC8.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of PDP context activation procedures rejected by the SGSN due to the ODB.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttModPdpContextMs.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted #MS#-Initiated #PDP# context modifications procedures.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttDeactPdpContextSgsnCC8.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted PDP context deactivation procedures triggered by the SGSN due to the ODB.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttDeactPdpContextSgsn.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted SGSN-initiated PDP context deactivation procedures. Note that the counter is incremented according to standard and also when sending "Deactivate PDP Context Request" to the #MS# after an "Error indication" is received from the #GGSN#. A message can handle more than one PDP context, then the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttUpdPdpContextSgsn.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted #SGSN#-initiated #PDP# context update procedures. This counter is incremented when the SGSN sends an Update PDP Context Request message to the GGSN.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccDeactPdpContextMs.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully completed #PDP# context deactivations. For these context deactivations, the #GGSN# is updated successfully (that is, deletion of the #PDP# context). A message can handle more than one PDP context, then the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC27_28.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful primary #PDP# context activation procedures per #SGSN# due to cause code 27 (Unknown or missing access point name), and cause code 28 (Unknown PDP address or PDP type). The counter is incremented when the #SGSN# interrogates the #DNS# resolver and there is a failure - name error or if #APN# (SGSN) is not defined or if requested #PDP# type not sent by #MS# - error.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccActSecondPdpContext.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully completed MS-Initiated and Network-Requested Secondary #PDP# context activations.

EntityDef.name: SM.ActPdpContextRedirectToDefaultApn.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #APN# redirections to the SGSN default APN per SGSN.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.NbrSubWithActBearer.G
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of subscribers in the GSM network having an activated S4 mode PDP context, that is, subscribers that can send and receive GPRS packet data. The gauge is incremented in the GSM network when a subscriber activates the first S4 mode PDP context and decremented in the GSM network when the subscriber deactivates the last S4 mode PDP context.
#Note: After a change to the #PDP# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #PDP# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 90% of the PDP capacity license limit
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 85% of the PDP capacity license limit

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModBearerS4Succ.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Modify Bearer Response messages with success received from the #SGW# in #GSM#, that is, the counter is incremented whenever a positive Modify Bearer Response message is received from the #SGW#.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.RANDowngradeS4QoS.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of PDP Contexts of which QoS is downgraded by the RAN during primary PDP Context Activation procedure in the S4-SGSN.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccUpdPdpContextGgsn.G
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of successfully handled #GGSN#-Initiated #PDP# context update procedures for #QoS# renegotiation. These updates are performed successfully when a positive update #PDP# context response is received from the #SGSN#.
Only #QoS# renegotiation procedures are counted.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttUpdPdpContextGgsn.G
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of attempted #GGSN#-initiated #PDP# context update procedures. An Update #PDP# Context Request message can be sent from a #GGSN# to an #SGSN# to renegotiate the #QoS# of a #PDP# context.
Only attempts at #QoS# renegotiation are counted.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccDeactPdpContextGgsn.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully handled #PDP# context deactivations initiated by the #GGSN#. For these context deactivations, the #MS# has accepted the #PDP# context deactivation. A message can handle more than one PDP context, then the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttModPdpContextSgsn.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted #SGSN#-initiated #PDP# context modifications procedures.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActPdpContext.G
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of attempted primary #PDP# context activation procedures. These include the static as well as the dynamic #PDP# addresses. The counter is incremented at the moment when SGSN identifies the message as a #RIL#3 Activate #PDP# Context Request message.
#Note: After a change to the #SAU# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #SAU# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 1% of the SAU Capacity License
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 0.5% of the SAU Capacity License

EntityDef.name: SM.DeactivatedPDPContextOldSgsn.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of deleted PDP contexts in old SGSN instead of transferring to new SGSN, that is when the T3 tunnel expires.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccActPdpContext.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully completed primary #PDP# context activations. For these context activations, the #GGSN# is updated successfully.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC32.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful PDP context activation procedures per SGSN due to cause code #32, "Service option not supported". It is incremented if the PDP type is not supported or the #NSAPI# is reserved.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActSecondPdpContextNtwkAcptByMs.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Network Requested Secondary #PDP# context activation requests accepted by an MS.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModPGWInitBearerQoSUpdateSucc.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Bearer Modification procedures with QoS update initiated by the PDN Gateway. The counter is incremented when the Update Bearer Response message is sent to the Serving Gateway. This message may contain multiple bearers. Each bearer with an indication of a successful bearer update is cumulated to the counter.

EntityDef.name: SM.NbrActivePdpPerSgsn.G
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of subscribers having an activated #PDP# context, that is subscribers that can send and receive #GPRS# packet data. The gauge is incremented when a subscriber activates the first context and decremented when the subscriber deactivates the last context.
#Note: After a change to the #PDP# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #PDP# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 90 % of the PDP capacity license limit
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 85 % of the PDP capacity license limit

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC32_33.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful #PDP# context activation procedures per #SGSN-MME# due to cause code 32 (Service option not supported), and cause code 33 (Requested Service Option not subscribed). The counter is incremented if the #PDP# Type is not supported, if #NSAPI# is reserved, or if the request is denied in the #SGSN-MME# due to subscriber data restriction.

EntityDef.name: SM.ActPdpContextRedirectToSubscribedDefaultApn.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of APN redirections to the subscribed default APN when using EPS subscription data per SGSN.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModPGWInitBearerQoSUpdateAtt.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Bearer Modification procedures with QoS update initiated by the PDN Gateway. The counter is incremented when the Update Bearer Request message arrives at the SGSN using the S4 interface. This message may contain multiple bearers, each bearer is cumulated to the counter.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccActSecondPdpContextNtwk.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully completed Network Requested Secondary #PDP# context activations.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC38.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful primary #PDP# Context activation procedures per #SGSN# due to cause code 38 (Network failure).

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC65.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful PDP context activation procedures per SGSN due to cause code 65 (Maximum number of PDP contexts reached). The counter is incremented when the number of simultaneous PDP contexts reaches the limit allowed for an attached user.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.DelPGWInitPDNSucc.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful PGW-initiated PDN Deactivation procedures sent to the Serving Gateway.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActSecondPdpContextNtwk.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Network Requested Secondary #PDP# context activations.

EntityDef.name: SM.ActPdpContextRedirectRejectedByImeiTac.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of APN redirections that is rejected by the APN Redirection criteria. This criteria is specified based on the IMEI-TAC of the MS.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC29.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful primary #PDP# context activation procedures per #SGSN# due to cause code 29 (User Authentication Failed). The counter is incremented if the request is rejected by the #GGSN# (#RADIUS#).

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.DelPGWInitPDNAtt.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted PGW-initiated PDN Deactivation procedures received from the Serving Gateway.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttDeactPdpContextSgsnCC39.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted SGSN-initiated PDP contexts deactivation procedures with cause code #39, "Reactivation Required". The cause code is sent to the #MS#. One message can handle more PDP contexts if the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttDeactPdpContextSgsnCC38.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted SGSN-initiated PDP context deactivation procedures with cause code 38, "Network failure". A message can handle more than one PDP context, then the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC26.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful primary #PDP# context Activation procedures per #SGSN-MME# due to cause code 26 (Insufficient resources). The reject can be caused due to, for example, sustained high processor load on one or more #AP#s, or if the hard limit for maximum number of #PDP# contexts is reached.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActPdpContextDyn.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted primary #PDP# context activation requests where a dynamic #PDP# address is required to be used.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccModPdpContextSgsn.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully handled #SGSN#-initiated #PDP# context modifications procedures. These modifications are performed successfully when a positive Modify PDP Context Accept message is received from the #MS#.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccActPdpContextDyn.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully completed primary #PDP# context activations where a dynamic #PDP# address is used.

EntityDef.name: SM.NotDeactivatedPDPContextOldSgsn.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of PDP contexts deactivated by the old SGSN after the contexts were transferred to the new SGSN. The reason is that the old SGSN aborted the ISRAU procedure when the MS re-entered the old SGSN's service area prior to the old SGSN receiving a CANCEL LOCATION message from the HLR.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModPGWInitBearerNoQoSUpdateAtt.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Bearer Modification procedures without QoS update initiated by the PDN Gateway. The counter is incremented when the Update Bearer Request message arrives at the SGSN using the S4 interface. This message may contain multiple bearers, each bearer is cumulated to the counter.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCamel.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful primary #PDP# context activation procedures per #SGSN#, due to #PDP# context activation denial, received from the gsmSCF. The counter is incremented when a #CAMEL# release message is received from the gsmSCF.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModPGWInitBearerNoQoSUpdateSucc.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Bearer Modification procedures without QoS update initiated by the PDN Gateway. The counter is incremented when the Update Bearer Response message is sent to the Serving Gateway. This message may contain multiple bearers. Each bearer with an indication of a successful bearer update is cumulated to the counter.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActSecondPdpContext.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted MS-Initiated and Network-Requested Secondary #PDP# context activation procedures.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC27.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful primary PDP context activation procedures per SGSN due to cause code #27, "Unknown or missing access point name". It is incremented when the SGSN interrogates the DNS resolver and there is a failure, for example, a name error or the default APN of the SGSN is not defined.

EntityDef.name: gprsSmSgsnUnsuccessfulModifications
EntityDef.description:
The gprsSmSgsnUnsuccessfulModifications measurement provides the number of unsuccessful #PDP# context modifications per #SGSN-MME#.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: This is an indication of high modification failure rate, typically caused by radio coverage problems or #GGSN# unavailability.

EntityDef.name: gprsSmSgsnDeactivations
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of #PDP# Context Deactivations per #SGSN# of the PDP Contexts that has been active in SGSN. The counter is also incremented when a PDP Context is moved from one system to another (that is #ISC#) and when a PDP Context is moved from one SGSN to another (that is #ISRAU#). A message can handle more than one PDP context, then the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ActDefaultBearerS4Att.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Create Session Request messages sent to the #SGW# in the #PDP# context activation procedure for #GSM#, that is, the counter is incremented whenever a Create Session Request message is sent to the #SGW#, excluding the retransmission in the #PDP# context activation procedure for #GSM#.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActPdpContextUscDiscarded.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the amount of attempted Primary PDP Context Activation messages that are discarded by UE Signaling Control. Incremented when UE Signaling Control is activated, and when it identifies an Activate PDP Context Request message during a control period. Applies to GSM systems only.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_Session_SM_G_U
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the Session_SM_G_U area.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextLicenseExceeded
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful #SM# procedures (#PDP# Context Activation and inter-#SGSN# #RAU# with active #PDP# contexts) per #SGSN# due to the capacity license PDP Context Limit being exceeded.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.HomeApnOiReplaceAtt
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of DNS query attempts with APN-OI-Replacement, while the UE is a home subscriber. This counter is deprecated now and is replaced by VS.SM.HomeApnOiReplaceAtt in the SGSN-MME_Session_SM group

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.HomeApnOiReplaceSucc
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful DNS query procedures with APN-OI-Replacement, while the UE is a home subscriber. This counter is deprecated now and is replaced by VS.SM.HomeApnOiReplaceSucc in the SGSN-MME_Session_SM group

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_Session_SM_U_RA
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the Session_SM_U_RA area.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccActPdpContextRa.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully completed primary #PDP# context activations per #RA# within this SGSN. For these context activations, the #GGSN# is updated successfully.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActPdpContextRa.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted primary #PDP# context activation procedures per #RA# within this SGSN. These include the static as well as the dynamic #PDP# addresses. The counter is incremented as the SGSN identifies the message as a RIL3 Activate PDP Context Request message.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_Session_SM_U
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the Session_SM_U area.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttDeactPdpContextSgsnCC8.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted PDP context deactivation procedures triggered by the SGSN due to the ODB.

EntityDef.name: SM.DeactivatedPDPContextOldSgsn.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of deleted PDP contexts in old SGSN instead of transferring to new SGSN, that is when the T3 tunnel expires.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttUpdPdpContextGgsn.U
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of attempted #GGSN#-initiated #PDP# context update procedures. An Update #PDP# Context Request message can be sent from a #GGSN# to an #SGSN# to renegotiate the #QoS# of a #PDP# context.
Only attempts at #QoS# negotiation are counted.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttDeactPdpContextSgsnCC38.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted SGSN-initiated PDP context deactivation procedures with cause code 38 "Network failure". A message can handle more than one PDP context, then the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: SM.ActPdpContextRedirectToSubscribedApn.U
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of #APN# redirections to the subscribed APN per SGSN.
#Note: If the SGSN default APN included in the subscribed data is used as the negotiated APN, this counter will exclude this scenario. Note#

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.NbrSwitchFrom3GDTForPDP.U
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of times the tunnel mode is switched from being of one tunnel (or direct tunnel) to two-tunnel.
Note: This measurement is only applicable for the tunnel switch due to Service Request Frequency.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC32.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful PDP context activation procedures per SGSN due to cause code #32, "Service option not supported". It is incremented if the PDP type is not supported or the #NSAPI# is reserved.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ReactPDNConnOnSgwSucc.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Create Session Response messages with "Accept" types of cause values received from the SGW in the Gateway Restoration procedure for WCDMA S4-SGSN.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActPdpContextSgsnHome.U
EntityDef.description: Number of attempted primary #PDP# Context Activation procedures per #SGSN# for home subscribers. Home subscribers are defined by the roaming status parameter during the #IMSI#-series configuration.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttRabModPS
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted RAB Modify Request procedures. It is incremented when RAB Modify Request is received.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActSecondPdpContext.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted MS-Initiated and Network-Requested Secondary #PDP# context activations.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModPGWInitBearerQoSUpdateSucc.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Bearer Modification procedures with QoS update initiated by the PDN Gateway. The counter is incremented when the Update Bearer Response message is sent to the Serving Gateway. This message may contain multiple bearers. Each bearer with an indication of a successful bearer update is cumulated to the counter.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModBearerCmdS4Succ.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Modify Bearer Command responses (Update Bearer Request messages) received from the SGW for WCDMA access. The measured data of this counter is incremented when an Update Bearer Request message is received from the SGW.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccActSecondPdpContextNtwk.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully completed Network Requested Secondary #PDP# context activations.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.DeactMsInitDedicatedBearerSucc.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful #MS#-Initiated Dedicated Bearer Deactivation Procedures over the S4 interface. The value is increased when the #S4-SGSN# sends a Deactivate PDP Context Accept message to the #MS#.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.DelPGWInitDedicatedBearerSucc.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully deactivated bearers during each #MS#-, #SGSN#-, or #PGW#-initiated Dedicated Bearer Deactivation Procedure over the S4 interface. The value is increased whenever a bearer is deactivated in the Delete Bearer Response message.

EntityDef.name: SM.NbrActivePDPsApprFor3GDT.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of active #PDP# contexts approved for 3G Direct Tunnel, that is, a 3G Direct Tunnel is set up for these PDP contexts when they run payload. Note: This gauge is not supervised, no threshold and clearing level apply.

EntityDef.name: SM.ActPdpContextRedirectToEpsSubscribedApn.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of APN redirections to the subscribed APN of the lowest context ID when using EPS subscription data per SGSN.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccActPdpContextDyn.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully completed primary #PDP# context activations where a dynamic #PDP# address is used.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.NbrSubWithActBearer.U
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of subscribers in WCDMA network having an activated PDP context of S4 mode, that is subscribers that can send and receive GPRS packet data. The gauge is incremented in WCDMA network when a subscriber activates the first context of S4 mode and decremented in WCDMA network when the subscriber deactivates the last context of S4 mode.
#Note: After a change to the #PDP# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #PDP# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 90% of the PDP capacity license limit
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 85% of the PDP capacity license limit

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccDeactPdpContextGgsn.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully handled #PDP# context deactivations initiated by the #GGSN#. For these context deactivations, the #MS# has accepted the #PDP# context deactivation. A message can handle more than one PDP context, then the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModBearerCmdS4Att.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Modify Bearer Command messages sent to the SGW for WCDMA access. The measured data of this counter is incremented when a Modify Bearer Command message is sent to the SGW, excluding the retransmission.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttUpdPdpContextSgsn.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted #SGSN#-initiated #PDP# context update procedures. This counter is incremented when the SGSN sends an Update PDP Context Request message to the GGSN.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.BearerQoSMismatch.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of EPS bearers with QoS mismatch between the S4-SGSN and PGW. It is incremented if the S4-SGSN does not receive a PGW-initiated QoS modification within a certain time after an EPS bearer has been downgraded due to QoS policy map during RAU from the S4-SGSN/MME to the S4-SGSN or handover from the MME to the S4-SGSN.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.NbrActBearerFor3GDT.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of active bearers approved for 3G Direct Tunnel on the SGSN supporting the S4 interface with #UMTS# access, that is, a 3G Direct Tunnel is set up for these bearers.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActPdpContextUscDiscarded.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the amount of attempted Primary PDP Context Activation messages that are discarded by UE Signaling Control. Incremented when UE Signaling Control activated, and when it identifies a Activate PDP Context Request message during a control period. Applies to WCDMA systems only.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActSecondPdpContextNtwkAcptByMs.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Network Requested Secondary #PDP# context activation requests accepted by MS.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccUpdPdpContextSgsn.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully handled #SGSN#-initiated #PDP# context update procedures. These updates are performed successfully when a positive update #PDP# context response is received from the #GGSN#.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttDeactPdpContextGgsn.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted GGSN-initiated PDP context deactivation procedures. A message can handle more than one PDP context, then the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActPdpContext.U
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of attempted primary #PDP# context activation procedures. These include the static as well as the dynamic #PDP# addresses. The counter is incremented at the moment when #SGSN# identifies the message as a #RIL#3 Activate #PDP# Context Request message.
#Note: After a change to the #SAU# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #SAU# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 1% of the SAU Capacity License
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 0.5% of the SAU Capacity License

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActPdpContextDyn.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted primary #PDP# context activation requests where a dynamic #PDP# address is required to be used.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttDeactPdpContextSgsnCC39.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted SGSN-initiated PDP contexts deactivation procedures cause code 39 "Reactivation Required". The cause code is sent to the #MS#. One message can handle more PDP contexts if the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModPGWInitBearerNoQoSUpdateAtt.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Bearer Modification procedures without QoS update initiated by the PDN Gateway. The counter is incremented when the Update Bearer Request message arrives at the SGSN using the S4 interface. This message may contain multiple bearers, each bearer is cumulated to the counter.

EntityDef.name: SM.ActPdpContextS4Ignored.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of ignored S4 primary PDP Context Activation procedures. The counter is increased when a new S4 primary PDP context activation request is ignored due to the first primary PDP context being activated or being deactivated.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModBearerS4Att.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Modify Bearer Request messages sent to the #SGW# in #WCDMA#, that is, the counter is incremented whenever a Modify Bearer Request message is sent to the #SGW# excluding the retransmission.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.DelPGWInitPDNAtt.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted PGW-initiated PDN Deactivation procedures received from the Serving Gateway.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttModPdpContextMs.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted #MS#-initiated #PDP# context modifications procedures.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttRabAssignment
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #RAB# setup attempts. The counter is incremented according to the number of required RABs setup included in RAB assignment request that is sent to the #RNC# with #IE# 'Setup RAB'.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccDeactPdpContextSgsn.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully handled #PDP# context deactivations initiated by the #SGSN#. Note that the counter is incremented according to standard and also when receiving "Delete PDP Context Response" from the #GGSN# for the cases when no "Deactivate PDP Context Response" can be received from the #MS# since no "Deactivate PDP Context Request" was sent to the #MS#. A message can handle more than one PDP context, then the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccDeactPdpContextMs.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully completed #PDP# context deactivations. For these context deactivations, the #GGSN# is updated successfully (that is, deletion of the #PDP# context). A message can handle more than one PDP context, then the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.DeactMsInitDedicatedBearerAtt.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted #MS#-Initiated Dedicated Bearer Deactivation Procedures over the S4 interface. The value is increased whenever the S4-#SGSN# receives a Deactivate PDP Context Request message from the MS.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC32_33.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful #PDP# Context activation procedures per #SGSN-MME# due to cause code 32 (Service option not supported), and cause code 33 (Requested Service Option not subscribed). The counter is incremented if the #PDP# Type is not supported, if #NSAPI# is reserved or if the request is denied in the #SGSN-MME# due to subscriber data restriction.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC27.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful primary PDP context activation procedures per SGSN due to cause code #27, "Unknown or missing access point name". It is incremented when the SGSN interrogates the DNS resolver and there is a failure, for example, a name error or the default APN of the SGSN is not defined.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC38.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful primary #PDP# context activation procedures per #SGSN# due to cause code 38 (Network failure).

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccRabAssignment
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful #RAB# setups. It is incremented when a RAB Assignment Response message is received, indicating successful #RAB# setup.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttModPdpContextSgsn.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted #SGSN#-initiated #PDP# context modifications procedures.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContext.U
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful #PDP# Context Activation procedures per #SGSN-MME#. The counter is incremented when an Activate (Secondary) #PDP# Context Reject or an SM Status message is sent as a response if an Activate (Secondary) #PDP# Context Request is unsuccessful.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: This is an indication of high activation failure rates, typically caused by misconfigured #MS#s using disallowed #APN#s. In this case the resulting cause code is 28 (Unknown #PDP# address or #PDP# type) or 33 (Requested service option not subscribed). If so, check the routines for providing #MS# configuration. #RADIUS# problems are also a common cause of high failure rates. In this case the resulting cause code is 29 (User authentication failed). The alarm can be caused by #GGSN# or #RADIUS# unavailability.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC65.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful PDP context activation procedures per SGSN due to cause code 65 (Maximum number of PDP contexts reached). The counter is incremented when the number of simultaneous PDP contexts reaches the limit allowed for an attached user.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ReactPDNConnOnSgwAtt.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Create Session Request messages sent to the restarted SGW in the Gateway Restoration procedure for WCDMA S4-SGSN. The counter does not increase if the Create Session Request message is retransmitted.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccActPdpContextSgsnHome.U
EntityDef.description: Number of successful primary #PDP# Context Activation procedures per #SGSN# for home subscribers. Home subscribers are defined by the roaming status parameter during the #IMSI#-series configuration.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ActDefaultBearerS4Att.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Create Session Request messages sent to the SGW in WCDMA, that is, the counter is incremented whenever a Create Session Request message is sent to the SGW excluding the retransmission.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC8.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of PDP context activation procedures rejected by the SGSN due to the ODB.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.RANDowngradeS4QoS.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of PDP Contexts of which QoS is downgraded by the RAN during primary PDP Context Activation procedure in the S4-SGSN.

EntityDef.name: SM.NbrActPdpContext.U
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of active #PDP# contexts, that is, the gauge is incremented whenever a new #PDP# context is activated and decremented whenever a #PDP# context is deactivated.
#Note: After a change to the #PDP# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #PDP# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: This is an indication that the #SGSN-MME# is approaching the maximum number of activated #PDP# contexts. Offload the #SGSN-MME#, for example, by moving one or more #RNC#s to a less loaded #SGSN-MME#.
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 90 % of the PDP capacity license limit
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 85 % of the PDP capacity license limit

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModPGWInitBearerQoSUpdateAtt.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Bearer Modification procedures with QoS update initiated by the PDN Gateway. The counter is incremented when the Update Bearer Request message arrives at the SGSN using the S4 interface. This message may contain multiple bearers, each bearer is cumulated to the counter.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccActPdpContext.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully completed primary #PDP# context activations. For these context activations, the #GGSN# is updated successfully.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ActPdpContextApnConverted.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of APN conversions in the PDP context activation procedure for UMTS.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ActPdpContextUscDetached.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the amount of Activate PDP Context Request messages that are controlled by the UE Signaling Control feature with the detach action. The counter applies only when the UE Signaling Control feature is activated in the Measurement and Control mode. The counter is increased whenever an Activate PDP Context Request message is identified and controlled by UE Signaling Control with the detach action during a control period.

EntityDef.name: SM.NbrActivePdpPerSgsn.U
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of mobile subscribers with activated #PDP# contexts, that is, subscribers that can send and receive #GPRS# packet data.The gauge is incremented when a subscriber activates the first context and decremented when the subscriber deactivates the last context.
#Note: After a change to the #PDP# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #PDP# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 90 % of the PDP capacity license limit
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 85 % of the PDP capacity license limit

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ActPGWInitDedicatedBearerSucc.U
EntityDef.description: For each attempted Network Requested Secondary #PDP# Context Activation Procedure using S4, this counter is incremented with the number of successfully activated bearers included in the Create Bearer Response.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC26.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful primary #PDP# context activation procedures per #SGSN-MME# due to cause code 26 (Insufficient resources). The reject can be caused due to, for example, sustained high processor load on one or more #AP#s, or if hard limit is applied for PDP context capacity and the number of PDP context reaches the licensed capacity limit of the #SGSN-MME#.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ActPdpContextUscRejected.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the amount of Activate PDP Context Request messages that are controlled by the UE Signaling Control feature with the reject action. The counter applies only when the UE Signaling Control feature is activated in the Measurement and Control mode. The counter is increased whenever an Activate PDP Context Request message is identified and controlled by UE Signaling Control with the reject action during a control period.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC27_28.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful primary #PDP# context activation procedures per #SGSN# due to cause code 27 (Unknown or missing access point name), and cause code 28 (Unknown PDP address or PDP type). The counter is incremented when the #SGSN# interrogates the #DNS# resolver and there is a failure - name error or if #APN# (SGSN) is not defined or if requested #PDP# type not sent by #MS# - error.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccModPdpContextMs.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully handled #MS#-initiated #PDP# context modifications procedures. These modifications are performed successfully when a Modify PDP Context Accept message is sent to the #MS#.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCamel.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful primary #PDP# context activation procedures per #SGSN#, due to PDP context activation denial, received from the gsmSCF. The counter is incremented when a CAMEL release message is received from the gsmSCF.

EntityDef.name: SM.NotDeactivatedPDPContextOldSgsn.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of PDP contexts deactivated by the old SGSN after the contexts were transferred to the new SGSN. The reason is that the old SGSN aborted the ISRAU procedure when the MS re-entered the old SGSN's service area prior to the old SGSN receiving a CANCEL LOCATION message from the HLR.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccUpdPdpContextGgsn.U
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of successfully handled #GGSN#-Initiated #PDP# context update procedures for #QoS# renegotiation. These updates are performed successfully when a positive update #PDP# context response is received from the #SGSN#.
Only #QoS# renegotiation procedures are counted.

EntityDef.name: SM.ActPdpContextRedirectToDefaultApn.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #APN# redirections to the SGSN default APN per SGSN.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ActPGWInitDedicatedBearerAtt.U
EntityDef.description: For each attempted Network Requested Secondary #PDP# Context Activation Procedure using S4, this counter is incremented with the number of bearers included in the Create Bearer Request.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.DelPGWInitDedicatedBearerAtt.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of bearers included in the Delete Bearer Request. The value is increased whenever a Delete Bearer Request is sent during each attempted #MS#-, #SGSN#-, or #PGW#-initiated Dedicated Bearer Deactivation Procedure over the S4 interface.

EntityDef.name: SM.UnsuccActPdpContextCC29.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unsuccessful primary #PDP# context activation procedures per #SGSN# due to cause code 29 (User Authentication Failed). The counter is incremented if the request is rejected by the #GGSN# (#RADIUS#).

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.NbrActBearer.U
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of active S4 mode PDP contexts in WCDMA network, that is, the gauge is incremented in WCDMA whenever a new PDP context of S4 mode is activated and decremented in WCDMA whenever a PDP context of S4 mode is deactivated.
#Note: After a change to the #PDP# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #PDP# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 90% of the PDP capacity license limit
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 85% of the PDP capacity license limit

EntityDef.name: SM.ActPdpContextRedirectToSubscribedDefaultApn.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of APN redirections to the subscribed default APN when using EPS subscription data per SGSN.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccModPdpContextSgsn.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully handled #SGSN#-initiated #PDP# context modifications procedures. These modifications are performed successfully when a positive Modify PDP Context Accept message is received from the #MS#.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.NbrSwitchTo3GDTForPDP.U
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of times the tunnel mode is switched from being of two-tunnels to one tunnel (or direct tunnel).
Note: This measurement is only applicable for the tunnel switch due to Service Request Frequency.

EntityDef.name: SM.SuccActSecondPdpContext.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successfully completed MS-Initiated and Network-Requested Secondary #PDP# context activations.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ActDefaultBearerS4Succ.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Create Session Response messages received from the SGW with success in WCDMA, that is, the counter is incremented whenever a Create Session Response message is received from the SGW.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.DelPGWInitPDNSucc.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful PGW-initiated PDN Deactivation procedures sent to the Serving Gateway.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModPGWInitBearerNoQoSUpdateSucc.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Bearer Modification procedures without QoS update initiated by the PDN Gateway. The counter is incremented when the Update Bearer Response message is sent to the Serving Gateway. This message may contain multiple bearers. Each bearer with an indication of a successful bearer update is cumulated to the counter.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttDeactPdpContextSgsn.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted SGSN-initiated PDP context deactivation procedures. Note that the counter is incremented according to standard and also when sending "Deactivate PDP Context Request" to the #MS# after an "Error indication" is received from the #GGSN#. A message can handle more than one PDP context, then the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ModBearerS4Succ.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Modify Bearer Response messages with success received from the #SGW# in #WCDMA#, that is, the counter is incremented whenever a positive Modify Bearer Response message is received from the #SGW#.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttActSecondPdpContextNtwk.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Network Requested Secondary #PDP# context activations.

EntityDef.name: SM.ActPdpContextRedirectRejectedByImeiTac.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of APN redirections that is rejected by the APN Redirection criteria. This criteria is specified based on the IMEI-TAC of the MS.

EntityDef.name: SM.AttDeactPdpContextMs.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted MS-initiated PDP context deactivation procedures. A message can handle more than one PDP context, then the TDI-flag is 1.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.NbrActDefaultBearer.U
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of active default EPS bearers in S4-SGSN, that is, the gauge is incremented when a new default EPS bearer is activated and decremented when a default EPS bearer is deactivated in S4-SGSN.
#Note: After a change to the #PDP# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #PDP# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 90% of the PDP capacity license limit
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 85% of the PDP capacity license limit

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.DelSgsnInitDedicatedBearerAtt.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of bearers included in the Delete Bearer Command. The value is increased whenever a Delete Bearer Command is sent during each attempted #MS#- or #SGSN#-initiated Dedicated Bearer Deactivation Procedure over the S4 interface.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_SubscriberManagement_MM
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the SubscriberManagement_MM area.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.NotifyHssPgwIdChange
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of times the notification procedure is used to inform the HSS about the assignment or change of a dynamically allocated PGW for an APN. This counter increases when a Notify Request message, including updated PGW ID information is sent to the HSS.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.CurLocRequestHssAtt
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Current Location requests from the HSS. It increases whenever an Insert Subscriber Data Request message with the IDR-flags IE indicating Current Location Request is received from the HSS.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.PgwIdChangeHssAtt
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of HSS-initiated PGW ID updates. This counter increases whenever an Insert Subscriber Data Request message, including updated PGW ID information is received from the HSS.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.LocRequestHssAtt
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted EPS Location Information requests from the HSS. It increases whenever an Insert Subscriber Data Request message with the IDR-flags IE indicating EPS Location Information Request is received from the HSS.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.PcscfRestoreHssAtt
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of the Insert Subscriber Data Request messages from the HSS requiring for P-CSCF Restoration, which is indicated by Bit8 in IDR-Flag.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.UsRequestHssAtt
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted EPS User State requests from the HSS. It increases whenever an Insert Subscriber Data Request message with the IDR-flags IE indicating EPS User State Request is received from the HSS.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.UrrpRequestHssAtt
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted UE Reachability requests from the HSS. It increases whenever an Insert Subscriber Data Request message with the IDR-flags IE indicating UE Reachability Request is received from the HSS.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.EmcPgwIdChangeHssAtt
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of HSS-initiated PGW ID updates. The Emergency PGW ID information is contained in an Insert Subscriber Data Request message. This counter is incremented when one of the following conditions is met: - When the feature bit Emergency Service Continuity is updated from unsupported to supported with a valid Emergency PGW ID information. - When the feature bit Emergency Service Continuity is updated from supported to unsupported and the previous Emergency PGW ID information is valid. - When the feature bit Emergency Service Continuity is set and it will not change after the Insert Subscriber Data Request, and the Emergency PGW ID information is updated from an empty value to a valid value, or vice versa. - When the feature bit Emergency Service Continuity is set and it will not change after the Insert Subscriber Data Request, and the Emergency PGW ID information is updated from a valid value to another valid value.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.TimerBasedPurgedUe
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of detached UEs that are purged when the timer-based purge function is enabled and the UE purge timer expires.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.TzRequestHssAtt
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Local Time Zone requests from the HSS. It increases whenever an Insert Subscriber Data Request message with the IDR-flags IE indicating Local Time Zone Request is received from the HSS.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.NotifyHssEmcPgwIdChange
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of times that the notification procedure is used to inform the HSS about the assignment or the change of a dynamically allocated PGW for a non-roaming authenticated UE. This counter is incremented when a Notify Request message including the updated emergency PGW ID information is sent to the HSS.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_SubscriberManagement_SM_U
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the SubscriberManagement_SM_U area.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.DelPGWInitPDNCC4Att.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted PGW-initiated PDN Deactivation. This counter is increased when the SGW receives the Delete Bearer Request message with cause code #4 (RAT changed from 3GPP to Non-3GPP).

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.DelPGWInitPDNCC4Succ.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful PGW-initiated PDN Deactivation. This counter is increased when the SGW receives the Delete Bearer Request message with cause code #4 (RAT changed from 3GPP to Non-3GPP) and the PDN Deactivation procedure is successful.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_SubscriberManagement_SUB
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the SubscriberManagement_SUB area.

EntityDef.name: VS.SUB.HssResetWithFullImsi
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of messages regarding HSS Reset with full IMSI. This measurement is incremented when a Reset Request message including one or more full IMSIs (15 digits) is received from the HSS.
Note: For the message including both full IMSI and IMSI prefix, the message is not counted.

EntityDef.name: SUB.DeleteSubscrDataHssAtt
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted delete subscriber data requests received from the HSS.

EntityDef.name: SUB.InsertSubscrDataHssAtt
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted insert subscriber data requests received from the HSS.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_Sx
EntityDef.description:
This PmGroup defines measurement types within the Sx area.
Note:The Sx interface is named Smp interface since SGSN-MME 1.10. For backward compatibility, the name Sx is still kept in operation and maintenance related fields.

EntityDef.name: gsnOverloadProtectionIgnoredOutboundRequestsSapc
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of outgoing request messages toward the SAPC that have been rejected by the outbound overload protection mechanism. This counter is incremented each time a Credit-Control-Request message toward the SAPC is rejected by the outbound overload protection mechanism. Note: This counter is now deprecated.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SapcPgwQuery.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number that the MME queries the PGW address that is returned by the SAPC for PDN connections. The counter is incremented each time the MME attempts to query the PGW address and the PGW address from SAPC is available. For example, the MME selects the PGW from SAPC to establish PDN connections during Attach or PDN connectivity request.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.NbrUeWithSession.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of UEs holding at least one active Smp session in the MME.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SessionTerminate.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Smp session terminations initiated by the MME. This counter is incremented each time the MME sends a Credit-Control-Request message with the TERMINATION_REQUEST type.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SessionReauthAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempts of Smp session re-authorization from the SAPC. This counter is incremented each time the MME receives a Re-Auth-Request message.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SessionInitialSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Smp session establishments in the MME. This counter is incremented each time the MME receives a successful Credit-Control-Answer message with the INITIAL_REQUEST type.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SessionUpdateAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempts of Smp session update by the MME. This counter is incremented each time the MME sends a Credit-Control-Request message with the UPDATE_REQUEST type.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SessionInitialAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempts of Smp session establishment in the MME. This counter is incremented each time the MME sends a Credit-Control-Request message with the INITIAL_REQUEST type.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SessionUpdateSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Smp session updates by the MME. This counter is incremented each time the MME receives a successful Credit-Control-Answer message with the UPDATE_REQUEST type.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.NbrActSessions.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of active Smp sessions in the MME.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SessionReauthSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Smp session re-authorizations from the SAPC. This counter is incremented each time the MME sends a successful Re-Auth-Answer message.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_SystemResource_PIU
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the SystemResource_PIU area.

EntityDef.name: SYS.gsnApSuUsage
EntityDef.description:
This measurement shows the current SU (Scheduler Utilization) usage per group of cores running AP functionality on a #PIU# or #VM#. The value is the average #SU# load measured on a per minute basis.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: If there is an indication of high #SU# load for a longer period of time, troubleshoot to find the reason for the high #SU# load. One remedy can be to offload the #SGSN-MME#, for example, by moving one or more #BSC#s, #RNC#s, or #eNodeB#s to a less loaded #SGSN-MME#. Overload can also occur in a recovery phase, for example, after a restart. In this case, no action is required.

EntityDef.name: SYS.gsnMemUsage
EntityDef.description:
This measurement shows the current memory usage per processor. This measurement is applicable for all boards except #CMXB#s. The value is the average memory consumption measured on a per minute basis.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: If there is an indication of high memory usage for a long period of time, troubleshoot to find the reason for the high memory usage.

EntityDef.name: SYS.gsnApCpuUsage
EntityDef.description:
This measurement shows the current #CPU# usage per group of cores running AP functionality on a #PIU# or #VM#. The value is the average #CPU# load measured on a per minute basis.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: If there is an indication of high #CPU# load for a longer period of time, troubleshoot to find the reason for the high #CPU# load. One remedy can be to offload the #SGSN-MME#, for example, by reconfiguring and moving part of the traffic to another interface, or by moving one or more #BSC#s, #RNC#s, or #eNodeB#s to a less loaded #SGSN-MME#. Overload can also occur in a recovery phase, for example, after a restart. In this case, no action is required.

EntityDef.name: SYS.gsnCpuUsage
EntityDef.description:
This measurement shows the current #CPU# usage per #PIU# or #VM#. The value is the average #CPU# load measured on a per minute basis.
This measurement is not applicable for #CMXB# #PIUs#.
This measurement does not indicate the #CPU# usage for traffic handling on #vLCs#. For #vLC# traffic handling #CPU# usage, use the measurement SYS.gnsLcCpuUsage. Half of the #vLC# #vCPUs# execute Data Plane Development Kit (DPDK) poll mode driver threads that are busy-looping, which leads to 100% #CPU# load. The other half of the #vLC# #vCPUs# execute functions that are not traffic-related and have approximately 0% #CPU# load in normal operation. Therefore, #vLC# #VMs# have a base #CPU# load of 50%. The base #CPU# load for #GPB# #VMs# with integrated #vLCs# equals ((number of #vLC# #CPUs#/2) / total number of #vCPUs#).
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: If there is an indication of high #CPU# load for a longer period of time, troubleshoot to find the reason for the high #CPU# load. One remedy can be to offload the #SGSN-MME#, for example, by reconfiguring and moving part of the traffic to another interface, or by moving one or more #BSC#s, #RNC#s, or #eNodeB#s to a less loaded #SGSN-MME#. Overload can also occur in a recovery phase, for example, after a restart. In this case, no action is required.

EntityDef.name: SYS.gsnLcCpuUsage
EntityDef.description:
This measurement shows the estimated #CPU# usage of the highest utilized core running #LC# functionality on a #VM#. The value is the average #CPU# load measured on a per minute basis.
The value is an estimate of the #CPU# usage for traffic handling on the #vLC#, because the #vLC# executes Data Plane Development Kit (DPDK) poll mode driver threads that are busy-looping at 100% #CPU# load. Therefore, the value cannot be compared with the #CPU# load measured on guest #OS# or cloud infrastructure level. For a #GPB# with integrated #vLC#, the value may show a high base load even without traffic.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: If there is an indication of high #CPU# load for a longer period of time, troubleshoot to find the reason for the high #CPU# load. One remedy can be to scale out with another vLC #VM#.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_SystemResource_PayloadDPInstance
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the SystemResource_PayloadDPInstance area.

EntityDef.name: SYS.gsnPayloadDpCpuUsage
EntityDef.description:
This measurement shows the current #CPU# usage per group of cores running Payload DP functionality on a #PIU# or #VM#. The value is the momentary #CPU# load measurement run through a low pass filter. Updated once per minute.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: If there is an indication of high #CPU# load for a longer period of time, troubleshoot to find the reason for the high #CPU# load. One remedy can be to offload the #SGSN-MME#, for example, by reconfiguring and moving part of the traffic to another interface, or by moving one or more #BSC#s, #RNC#s, or #eNodeB#s to a less loaded #SGSN-MME#. Overload can also occur in a recovery phase, for example, after a restart. In this case, no action is required.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_SystemResource_IPPayload_G
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the SystemResource_IPPayload_G area.

EntityDef.name: SYS.PayloadAllocationFailure.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of deleted IP packets due to memory allocation failure.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_SystemResource_IPPayload_U
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the SystemResource_IPPayload_U area.

EntityDef.name: SYS.PayloadAllocationFailure.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of deleted IP packets due to memory allocation failure.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_UserEquipment_S13
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the UserEquipment_S13 area.

EntityDef.name: VS.IMEI.CheckImeiRspBlackS13
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of answers with equipment status set to BLACKLISTED received from the #EIR# through the S13 interface.

EntityDef.name: VS.IMEI.CheckImeiRspUnknownS13
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of answers indicating that the #ME# is unknown to the #EIR#.

EntityDef.name: VS.IMEI.CheckImeiRspGreyS13
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of answers with equipment status set to GREYLISTED received from the #EIR# through the S13 interface.

EntityDef.name: VS.IMEI.CheckImeiReqS13
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of requests for #IMEI# Check sent to the #EIR# through the S13 interface.

EntityDef.name: VS.IMEI.CheckImeiRspWhiteS13
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of answers with equipment status set to WHITELISTED received from the #EIR# through the S13 interface.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_UserEquipment_Gf
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the UserEquipment_Gf area.

EntityDef.name: nbrOfWhiteAnswerInSgsn
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of white list answers received from the #EIR#. Note that the counter contains a total count for both #GSM# and #WCDMA# System.

EntityDef.name: nbrOfCheckIMEIRequest
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of check #IMEI# requests sent to the #EIR#. Note that the counter contains a total count for both #GSM# and #WCDMA# System.
