EntityDef.name: nbrOfBlackAnswerInSgsn
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of black list answers received from the #EIR#. Note that the counter contains a total count for both #GSM# and #WCDMA# System.

EntityDef.name: nbrOfGreyAnswerInSgsn
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of gray list answers received from the #EIR#. Note that the counter contains a total count for both #GSM# and #WCDMA# System.

EntityDef.name: nbrOfUnknownAnswerInSgsn
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of unknown #IMEI# answers received from the #EIR#.Note that the counter contains a total count for both #GSM# and #WCDMA# System.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_WCDMA_GSM_ISYSC
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the WCDMA_GSM_ISYSC area.

EntityDef.name: ISYSC.SuccIntraSgsnGsmUmtsRau
EntityDef.description: Number of successful intra-#SGSN# inter-system changes from #GSM# to #WCDMA# System.

EntityDef.name: ISYSC.AttIntraSgsnGsmUmtsRau
EntityDef.description: Number of attempted intra-#SGSN# inter-system changes from #GSM# to #WCDMA# System.

EntityDef.name: ISYSC.SuccIntraSgsnUmtsGsmRau
EntityDef.description: Number of successful intra-#SGSN# inter-system changes from #WCDMA# System to #GSM#.

EntityDef.name: ISYSC.AttIntraSgsnUmtsGsmRau
EntityDef.description: Number of attempted intra-#SGSN# inter-system changes from #WCDMA# System to #GSM#.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_WIFI
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the WIFI area.

EntityDef.name: VS.WIFI.EstimateRcvd.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Estimate Request messages received from the Wi-Fi Controller over the U2 interface. This counter is incremented each time an Estimate Request message is received from the Wi-Fi Controller.

EntityDef.name: VS.WIFI.EstimateResp.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Estimate Response messages sent from the MME to the Wi-Fi Controller. This counter is incremented each time a successful Estimate Response message is sent by the MME.

EntityDef.name: VS.WIFI.AccessResp.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Access Response messages sent from the MME to the Wi-Fi Controller. This counter is incremented each time a successful Access Response message is sent by the MME.

EntityDef.name: VS.WIFI.AccessDecisionAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of EAB WIFI Access Decision Request messages sent from the MME to the eNodeB over the S1-MME interface. This counter is incremented each time an EAB WIFI Access Decision Request message is sent by the MME.

EntityDef.name: VS.WIFI.UeLocationUpdateAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of UE Location Update messages sent to the Wi-Fi UE Locator over the U1a interface. This counter is incremented each time a UE Location Update message is sent to the Wi-Fi UE Locator.

EntityDef.name: VS.WIFI.ThroughputEstimateSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful EAB Throughput Estimation Response messages received from the eNodeB. This counter is incremented each time when the MME receives an EAB Throughput Estimation Response message from the eNodeB.

EntityDef.name: VS.WIFI.AccessRcvd.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Access Request messages received from the Wi-Fi Controller over the U2 interface. This counter is incremented each time an Access Request message is received from the Wi-Fi Controller.

EntityDef.name: VS.WIFI.ThroughputEstimateAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of EAB Throughput Estimation Request messages sent from the MME to the eNodeB over the S1-MME interface. This counter is incremented each time an EAB Throughput Estimation Request message is sent by the MME.

EntityDef.name: VS.WIFI.FirstUpdateIndicationRcvd.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of First Update Indication messages received from the Wi-Fi UE Locator over the U1a interface. This counter is incremented each time a First Update Indication message is received from the Wi-Fi UE Locator.

EntityDef.name: VS.WIFI.AccessDecisionSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful EAB WIFI Access Decision Response messages received from the eNodeB. This counter is incremented each time a successful EAB WIFI Access Decision Response message is received from the eNodeB.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_eMBMS
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the eMBMS area.

EntityDef.name: VS.EMBMS.M3SessionStartSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of MBMS Session Start Response messages with success received from the MCEs over the M3 interface, that is, the counter is incremented whenever a positive MBMS Session Start Response message is received from an MCE.

EntityDef.name: VS.EMBMS.NbrDisconnectedMce.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of currently disconnected MCEs.

EntityDef.name: VS.EMBMS.NbrActSession.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of active eMBMS sessions in the MME.

EntityDef.name: VS.EMBMS.SmSessionStopSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of MBMS Session Stop Response messages with success sent to the MBMS-GW over the Sm interface, that is, the counter is incremented whenever a MBMS Session Stop Response message with success is sent to the MBMS-GW.

EntityDef.name: VS.EMBMS.M3SessionStopSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of MBMS Session Stop Response messages with success received from the MCEs over the M3 interface, that is, the counter is incremented whenever a MBMS Session Stop Response message with success is received from an MCE.

EntityDef.name: VS.EMBMS.SmSessionStartAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of MBMS Session Start Request messages received from the MBMS-GW over the Sm interface, that is, the counter is incremented whenever an MBMS Session Start Request message is received from the MBMS-GW.

EntityDef.name: VS.EMBMS.M3SessionStartAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of MBMS Session Start Request messages sent to the MCEs over the M3 interface, that is, the counter is incremented whenever an MBMS Session Start Request message is sent to the MCEs.

EntityDef.name: VS.EMBMS.SmSessionStartSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of MBMS Session Start Response messages with success sent to the MBMS-GW over the Sm interface, that is, the counter is incremented whenever a MBMS Session Start Response message with success is sent to the MBMS-GW.

EntityDef.name: VS.EMBMS.M3SessionStopAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of MBMS Session Stop Request messages sent to the MCEs over the M3 interface, that is, the counter is incremented whenever an MBMS Session Stop Request message is sent to the MCEs.

EntityDef.name: VS.EMBMS.SmSessionStopAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of MBMS Session Stop Request messages received from the MBMS-GW over the Sm interface, that is, the counter is incremented whenever an MBMS Session Stop Request message is received from the MBMS-GW.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_DiameterApp
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the Diameter Application Area

EntityDef.name: diaAppMessageSent
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of messages sent per Diameter application. This measurement type is indexed per application name, that is, S6a (S6d), S13, Sx (Smp), SGd, and SLg.

EntityDef.name: diaAppMessageReceived
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of messages received per Diameter application. This measurement type is indexed per application name, that is, S6a (S6d), S13, Sx (Smp), SGd, and SLg.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_DiameterBase
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the Diameter Base Protocol Area

EntityDef.name: diaBaseMessageSent
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of messages sent over the Diameter base protocol per Diameter peer. This measurement type is indexed using the primary IP address of the peer.

EntityDef.name: diaBaseMessageReceived
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of messages received over the Diameter base protocol per Diameter peer. This measurement type is indexed using the primary IP address of the peer.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_GTP_Interface
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the GTP-C Area, indexed on GTP interface.

EntityDef.name: VS.GTP.GtpMessageReceived
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of GTP-C messages received per GTP interface. This measurement type is indexed per GTP-C interface, that is, Gn, S3, S4, S10, S11, S16, Sm, and Sv. The measurement type with index Gn includes messages received over the Gn and Gp interfaces (GTPv0 and GTPv1). Note: For the measurement to measure the number of messages received per GTP-C interface (IP service), each IP service needs to be configured with a different IP service address.

EntityDef.name: VS.GTP.GtpMessageSent
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of GTP-C messages sent per GTP interface. This measurement type is indexed per GTP-C interface, that is, Gn, S3, S4, S10, S11, S16, Sm, and Sv. The measurement type with index Gn includes messages sent over the Gn and Gp interfaces (GTPv0 and GTPv1). Note: For the measurement to measure the number of messages sent per GTP-C interface (IP service), each IP service needs to be configured with a different IP service address.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_Sx_U
EntityDef.description:
This PmGroup defines measurement types within the Sx_U area.
Note:The Sx interface is named Smp interface since SGSN-MME 1.10. For backward compatibility, the name Sx is still kept in operation and maintenance related fields.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SessionInitialAtt.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempts of Smp session establishment in the SGSN. This counter is incremented each time the SGSN sends a Credit-Control-Request message with the INITIAL_REQUEST type.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.NbrUeWithSession.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of UEs holding at least one active Smp session in the SGSN.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SessionTerminate.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of Smp session termination procedures initiated by the SGSN. This counter is incremented each time the SGSN sends a Credit-Control-Request message with the TERMINATION_REQUEST type.

EntityDef.name: gsnOverloadProtectionIgnoredOutboundRequestsSapc
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of outgoing request messages toward the SAPC that have been rejected by the outbound overload protection mechanism. This counter is incremented each time a Credit-Control-Request message toward the SAPC is rejected by the outbound overload protection mechanism. Note: This counter is now deprecated.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.NbrActSessions.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of active Smp sessions in the SGSN.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SessionUpdateAtt.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Smp session update procedures initiated by the SGSN. This counter is incremented each time the SGSN sends a Credit-Control-Request message with the UPDATE_REQUEST type.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SessionUpdateSucc.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Smp session update procedures initiated by the SGSN. This counter is incremented each time the SGSN receives a successful Credit-Control-Answer message with the UPDATE_REQUEST type.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SessionReauthSucc.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Smp session re-authorization from the SAPC to the SGSN. This counter is incremented each time the SGSN sends a successful Re-Auth-Answer message.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SapcGwQuery.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number that the SGSN queries the GGSN/PGW address that is returned by the SAPC for PDP connections. The counter is incremented each time the SGSN attempts to query the GGSN/PGW address and the GGSN/PGW address from SAPC is available. For example, the SGSN selects the GGSN/PGW from SAPC to establish PDP connections during a primary PDP context activation procedure.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SessionReauthAtt.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempts of Smp session re-authorization from the SAPC to the SGSN. This counter is incremented each time the SGSN receives a Re-Auth-Request message.

EntityDef.name: VS.Sx.SessionInitialSucc.U
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Smp session establishments in the SGSN. This counter is incremented each time the SGSN receives a successful Credit-Control-Answer message with the INITIAL_REQUEST type.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_Session_SM_E_QCI
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the Session_SM_E_QCI area. The QCI index can be configured by the QciCounterIndexList parameter.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.NbrActBearerQCI.E
EntityDef.description: This gauge provides the number of activated EPS bearers (both default and dedicated) per QCI. The gauge is incremented for the used QCI when a new EPS bearer is activated. The gauge is decremented for the used QCI when a new EPS bearer is deactivated. When the QCI is modified for an existing EPS bearer, the gauge is incremented for the new QCI, and decremented for the old QCI.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.PGWInitDeleteBearerQCIAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Bearer Deactivation procedures for bearers with the indexed QCIs initiated by the PDN Gateway. The counter is increased when the MME receives a Delete Bearer Request from SGW without having sent a Delete Bearer Command to SGW. Both Default and Dedicated bearers are counted.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.EnbOrMmeInitDeleteBearerQCIAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Bearer Deactivation procedures initiated by the eNodeB, or the MME indexed per QCI. The counter is incremented when the MME sends a Delete Bearer Command message over S11 to the SGW, or when the MME sends a Delete Session Request over S11 to SGW. Both default and dedicated bearers are counted, as well as the dedicated bearers that are implicitly deleted when a default bearer is deleted. The measurement will exclude the scenarios where UE triggers the procedure.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.PGWInitModBearerQCIAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Bearer Modification procedures initiated by the PDN Gateway for bearers indexed per QCI. The counter is incremented when the Update Bearer Request message, related to one or multiple bearers, arrives at the MME. This counter is incremented for the new QCI value. Both default and dedicated bearers are counted. The counter is only incremented for Bearer IDs known to the MME.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.PGWInitDeleteBearerQCISucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Bearer Deactivation procedures for bearers with the indexed QCIs sent over S11 to the SGW. The counter is increased when the MME sends a successful Delete Bearer Response to SGW without having sent a Delete Bearer Command to SGW. Both Default and Dedicated bearers are counted.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ActBearerQCISucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Default Bearer Activation procedures. This measurement is indexed by QCI. The indexed counter is incremented when the MME receives a successful Modify Bearer Response message. Note: In the case that the requested QCI can be changed by the network in the Default Bearer Activation procedure, VS.SM.ActBearerQCIAtt.E and VS.SM.ActBearerQCISucc.E cannot be used to calculate the Default Bearer Activation failure ratio per QCI.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.CreateDedicatedBearerQCISucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful EPS Bearer Activations for dedicated bearers with the indexed QCI on S11, initiated from SGW/PGW towards MME. For each successful Create Bearer Request for the indexed QCI(s), this counter is incremented with the number of successful bearers included in the request.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.PGWInitModBearerQCISucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Bearer Modification procedures initiated by the PDN Gateway for bearers indexed per QCI. The counter is incremented when the Update Bearer Response, related to one or multiple bearers, is sent over S11 to the SGW. This counter is incremented for the new QCI value. Both default and dedicated bearers are counted. The counter is only incremented for Bearer IDs known to the MME.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.CreateDedicatedBearerQCIAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted EPS Bearer Activations for dedicated bearers with the indexed QCI on S11, initiated from SGW/PGW towards MME. For each Create Bearer Request for the indexed QCI(s), this counter is incremented with the number of bearers included in the request.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.ActBearerQCIAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Default Bearer Activation procedures. This measurement is indexed by QCI. The indexed counter is incremented when the MME receives a PDN Connectivity Request message from the UE and determines the QCI. Note: In the case that the requested QCI can be changed by the network in the Default Bearer Activation procedure, VS.SM.ActBearerQCIAtt.E and VS.SM.ActBearerQCISucc.E cannot be used to calculate the Default Bearer Activation failure ratio per QCI.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.EnbOrMmeInitDeleteBearerQCISucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Bearer Deactivation procedures initiated by the eNodeB, or the MME indexed per QCI. The counter is incremented when the MME sends a Delete Bearer Response over S11 to SGW, having already sent a Delete Bearer Command to SGW, or when the MME receives a Delete Session Response over S11 from SGW. Both default and dedicated bearers are counted, as well as the dedicated bearers that are implicitly deleted when a default bearer is deleted. MME will internally remove the successful and unsuccessful bearers after the MME sends a Delete Bearer Command or a Delete Session Request. The measurement will exclude the scenarios where UE triggers the procedure.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_OverloadProtection_Sx
EntityDef.description:
This PmGroup defines measurement types within the OverloadProtetion_Sx area.
Note: The Sx interface is named Smp interface since SGSN-MME 1.10. For backward compatibility, the name Sx is still kept in operation and maintenance related fields.

EntityDef.name: gsnOverloadProtectionIgnoredOutboundRequestsSapc
EntityDef.description: "This measurement provides the total number of outgoing request messages toward the SAPC that have been rejected by the outbound overload protection mechanism. This counter is incremented each time a Credit-Control-Request message toward the SAPC is rejected by the outbound overload protection mechanism.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_Session_SM_E_ARP
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the Session_SM_E_ARP area.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.NbrActBearerARP.E
EntityDef.description: This gauge provides the number of activated EPS bearers (both default and dedicated) per ARP. The gauge is incremented for the used ARP when a new EPS bearer is activated. The gauge is decremented for the used ARP when a new EPS bearer is deactivated. When the ARP is modified for an existing EPS bearer, the gauge is incremented for the new ARP, and decremented for the old ARP.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_BfdNeighbor
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the BfdNeighbor area.

EntityDef.name: bfdNeighborDownEvents
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of times the connection to a BFD neighbor has been lost.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_SessionResilience
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the SessionResilience area.

EntityDef.name: gsnSessionResilienceNotInitializedConnections
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of subscribers who have not yet started to signal after an AP takeover. These subscribers are in an incomplete state. Subscribers in an incomplete state are not included in other PM gauge values.
The state of a subscriber changes to initiated either when the subscriber signals again, or automatically within one hour from the AP takeover.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_M2M_E
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the M2M_E area.

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.PagingLowComplexityUeAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of attempted Paging procedures initiated for low-complexity UEs. The counter is incremented when a Paging message is sent to the eNodeB at the first transmission. Retransmissions of the same Paging message are not counted. Note: Paging procedures triggered by NTSR or CSSR are not counted in this counter. Paging procedures triggered by NTSR are counted in VS.GeoRed.AttPagingForNTSR.E. Paging procedures triggered by CSSR are counted in VS.GeoRed.AttPagingForCSSR.E.

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.PagingEdrxUeSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of successful paging procedures from the MME to UEs using eDRX mode. The counter is incremented when a Service Request or a NAS message from the UE is received while the paging procedure is still active.

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.NbrAttachedCeModeUe.E
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of currently attached UEs in the Coverage Enhancement (CE) mode. The gauge is incremented when an attached UE enters the CE mode, independently of if Coverage Extension Support, LTE license is granted, or if granted, independently of if the feature is enabled. The gauge is decremented when a UE is out of the CE mode, detaches from, or moves out of the MME.
The UE in the CE mode is identified with the CE mode indication in UE Radio Capability IE included in the UE CAPABILITY INFO INDICATION message from the eNodeB. The gauge is incremented when the MME receives UE CAPABILITY INFO INDICATION message from the eNodeB and the CE mode is indicated in the UE Radio Capability IE.
#Note: After a change to the #SAU# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #SAU# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 90% of the SAU capacity license limit
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 85% of the SAU capacity license limit

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.NbrAttachedLowComplexityUe.E
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of currently attached low-complexity UEs. The counter is incremented when a low-complexity UE attaches to or moves into the MME. The counter is decremented when a low-complexity UE detaches from or moves out of the MME.
#Note: After a change to the #SAU# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #SAU# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 90% of the SAU capacity license limit
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 85% of the SAU capacity license limit

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.PagingEdrxUeAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of attempted paging procedures from the MME to UEs using eDRX mode. The counter is incremented when a paging message is sent to the eNodeB at the first transmission. Retransmissions of paging messages are not counted. Note: Paging procedures triggered by NTSR or CSSR are not counted in this counter. Paging procedures triggered by NTSR are counted in VS.GeoRed.AttPagingForNTSR.E. Paging procedures triggered by CSSR are counted in VS.GeoRed.AttPagingForCSSR.E.

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.NbrAttachedEdrxUe.E
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of currently attached UEs using eDRX mode. The gauge is incremented when a UE attaches to or moves into MME with eDRX mode activated. The gauge is decremented when a UE detaches from or moves out of MME or deactivates eDRX mode.
#Note: After a change to the #SAU# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #SAU# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 90% of the SAU capacity license limit
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 85% of the SAU capacity license limit

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.NbrPendingPagingEdrxUe.E
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of UEs using eDRX mode with a paging procedure pending. This measurement is incremented when a paging procedure, from the MME to a UE using eDRX mode, is pending. This measurement is decremented when the paging procedure is started or discarded.
#Note: After a change to the #SAU# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #SAU# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 90% of the SAU capacity license limit
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 85% of the SAU capacity license limit

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.PagingEdrxUePtwClosed.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of eDRX paging procedures discarded because the paging time window (PTW) closed at paging timeout.

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.PagingEdrxUeDelayed.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of eDRX paging procedures delayed because the UE is using eDRX mode.

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.PagingLowComplexityUeSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of successful Paging procedures initiated for low-complexity UEs, irrespective of the paging being an initial Paging message or the resending of the Paging message. The counter is incremented when a Service Request or any NAS message from the UE is received.

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.PagingCeModeUeAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of attempted Paging procedures initiated for UEs in the Coverage Enhancement (CE) mode. The counter is incremented when a Paging message is sent to the eNodeB at the first transmission. Retransmissions of the same Paging message are not counted. Note: Paging procedures triggered by NTSR or CSSR are not counted in this counter. Paging procedures triggered by NTSR are counted in VS.GeoRed.AttPagingForNTSR.E. Paging procedures triggered by CSSR are counted in VS.GeoRed.AttPagingForCSSR.E.

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.PagingCeModeUeSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of successful Paging procedures initiated for UEs in the Coverage Enhancement (CE) mode, irrespective of the paging being an initial Paging message or the resending of the Paging message. The counter is incremented when a Service Request or any NAS message from the UE is received.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_MSCPool_E
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the MSCPool_E area.

EntityDef.name: MM.NbrSgsAssociatedSubMsc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of UEs for which the MME has SGs associations with an MSC. This gauge is counted per MSC.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_SystemResource_Ss7SctpDPInstance
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the SystemResource_Ss7SctpDPInstance area.

EntityDef.name: SYS.gsnSs7SctpDpCpuUsage
EntityDef.description:
This measurement shows the current #CPU# usage per group of cores running SS7/SCTP DP functionality on a #PIU# or #VM#. The value is the momentary #CPU# load measurement run through a low pass filter. Updated once per minute.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: If there is an indication of high #CPU# load for a longer period of time, troubleshoot to find the reason for the high #CPU# load. One remedy can be to offload the #SGSN-MME#, for example, by reconfiguring and moving part of the traffic to another interface, or by moving one or more #BSC#s, #RNC#s, or #eNodeB#s to a less loaded #SGSN-MME#. Overload can also occur in a recovery phase, for example, after a restart. In this case, no action is required.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_SDS
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the SGs-Lite area.

EntityDef.name: VS.SDS.ImsiDetachAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted IMSI Detach Indication procedures on the SGs-Lite interface. This counter is incremented when the MME sends an SGSLite-IMSI-DETACH-INDICATION message to an SDS GW, excluding the retransmission. Note: This counter is restricted and not for general use.

EntityDef.name: VS.SDS.DownlinkUnitdataAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Downlink Unitdata procedures on the SGs-Lite interface. This counter is incremented when the MME receives an SGSLite-DOWNLINK-UNITDATA message from an SDS GW. Note: This counter is restricted and not for general use.

EntityDef.name: VS.SDS.LocationUpdateSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Location Update procedures on the SGs-Lite interface, initiated within the MME. This counter is incremented when the MME receives an SGSLite-LOCATION-UPDATE-ACK message with cause code "success" from an SDS GW. Note: This counter is restricted and not for general use.

EntityDef.name: VS.SDS.ImsiDetachSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Detach Indication procedures on the SGs-Lite interface, initiated within the MME. This counter is incremented when the MME successfully receives an SGSLite-IMSI-DETACH-ACK message from an SDS GW for a UE and the UE context is still present in the MME. Note: This counter is restricted and not for general use.

EntityDef.name: VS.SDS.DownlinkUnitdataSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Downlink Unitdata procedures on the SGs-Lite interface. This counter is incremented when the MME sends an S1-AP Downlink NAS Transport message to an SDS UE. Note: This counter is restricted and not for general use.

EntityDef.name: VS.SDS.LocationUpdateAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Location Update procedures on the SGs-Lite interface, initiated within the MME. This counter is incremented when the MME sends an SGSLite-LOCATION-UPDATE-REQUEST message to an SDS GW, excluding the retransmission. Note: This counter is restricted and not for general use.

EntityDef.name: VS.SDS.UplinkUnitdataAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted Uplink Unitdata procedures on the SGs-Lite interface, initiated within the MME. This counter is incremented when the MME sends an SGSLite-UPLINK-UNITDATA message to an SDS GW, excluding the retransmission. Note: This counter is restricted and not for general use.

EntityDef.name: VS.SDS.UplinkUnitdataSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful Uplink Unitdata procedures on the SGs-Lite interface, initiated within the MME. This counter is incremented when the MME receives an SGSLite-UPLINK-ACK message from an SDS GW. Note: This counter is restricted and not for general use.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_UeSecurity_Auc
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the UeSecurity_Auc area.

EntityDef.name: VS.SEC.AucInfoAnsFailAuc.5420
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of failed Authentication Information Retrieval procedures with Experimental-Result-Code 5420 from AuCs which are separated from HSS nodes and directly connected to the MME.

EntityDef.name: VS.SEC.AucInfoAnsFailAuc.5001
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of failed Authentication Information Retrieval procedures with Experimental-Result-Code 5001 from AuCs which are separated from HSS nodes and directly connected to the MME.

EntityDef.name: VS.SEC.AuthInfoAucAtt
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted S6a Authentication Information Retrieval procedures toward AuCs which are separated from HSS nodes and directly connected to the MME.

EntityDef.name: VS.SEC.AuthInfoAucSucc
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful S6a Authentication Information Retrieval procedures toward AuCs which are separated from HSS nodes and directly connected to the MME.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_LocationServices_E
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the LocationServices_E area.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.MtlrSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful initial #MT-LR# procedures in the #SGSN-MME#, which includes all the LCS Client Types requested from the GMLC over the SLg Interface. The procedure is considered successful when the #E-SMLC# has provided an estimation of the UE's location. Procedures related to resending Location Request messages to alternative E-SMLCs are excluded. Trigger: Sending the Provide Subscriber Location Response message to the #GMLC# over the SLg interface with a successful result code, if only one E-SMLC has been tried during the procedure. Note: The number of successful MT-LR procedures for queued emergency SLg sessions are also counted.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.LocationRequestSuccRetry.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful location service request procedures in the SGSN-MME if more than one E-SMLC has been tried. The procedures include all the LCS Client Types sent to the E-SMLC over the SLs interface. Trigger: Reception of the LCS-AP Location Response message from the alternative E-SMLC over the SLs interface with a successful result code.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.NilrSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful #NI-LR# procedures in the #SGSN-MME#. Trigger: Reception of the Subscriber Location Report Ack message from the #GMLC# with a successful result code.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.NilrAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted SLg #NI-LR# procedures in the #SGSN-MME#. Trigger: Sending the Subscriber Location Report message to the #GMLC# over the SLg interface.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.LocationRequestAttRetry.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of retried Location Request messages in location service request procedures in the SGSN-MME, which includes all the LCS Client Types sent to the E-SMLC over the SLs interface. Trigger: Re-Sending the LCS-AP Location Request message to the next alternative E-SMLC when the response to the previous request fails over the SLs interface.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.LocationRequestSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful initial location service request procedures in the #SGSN-MME#, which includes all the LCS Client Types sent to the E-SMLC over the SLs interface. Procedures related to resending Location Request messages to alternative E-SMLCs are excluded. Trigger: Reception of the LCS-AP Location Response message from the first selected #E-SMLC# over the SLs interface with a successful result code.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.MtlrAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted #MT-LR# procedures in the #SGSN-MME#, which includes all the LCS Client Types requested from the GMLC over the SLg interface. Trigger: Reception of a Provide Subscriber Location Request message from the #GMLC# over the SLg interface.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.ConnectionLessLPPaAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted LPPa Connectionless Information signaling initiated by an E-SMLC within this MME area. Trigger: Receiving a Connectionless Information message with an LPPa container from the E-SMLC over the SLs interface.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.MtlrFailDueToPreemption.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of failed MT-LR procedures because of the preemption in the SGSN-MME. The counter is incremented when one MT-LR procedure with non-emergency LCS Client Type is aborted by another MT-LR procedure with emergency LCS Client Type.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.LocationRequestAtt.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted initial location service request procedures in the #SGSN-MME#, which includes all the LCS Client Types sent to the #E-SMLC# over the SLs interface. Procedures related to resending Location Request messages to alternative E-SMLCs are excluded. Trigger: Sending the initial LCS-AP Location Request message to the #E-SMLC# over the SLs interface.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.QueueEmcMtlrSucc.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful #MT-LR# procedures for queued emergency SLg sessions. The queued emergency SLg sessions are considered successful when the #E-SMLC# has provided an estimation of the UE's location for the ongoing emergency positioning request. The counter is incremented when the #MME# sends the Provide Subscriber Location Response message to the #GMLC# over the SLg interface using the existing successful positioning result from the ongoing #MT-LR# procedure.

EntityDef.name: VS.MM.MtlrSuccRetry.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful MT-LR procedures in the SGSN-MME, which includes all the LCS Client Types requested from the GMLC over the SLg interface. The procedure is considered successful when the E-SMLC has provided an estimation of the UE's location. Trigger: Sending the Provide Subscriber Location Response message to the GMLC over the SLg interface with a successful result code, if more than one E-SMLC has been tried during the procedure.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_SubscriberManagement_SM_E
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the SubscriberManagement_SM_E area.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.DelPGWInitPDNCC4Succ.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of successful PGW-initiated PDN Deactivations due to change from LTE to non-3GPP access. This counter is incremented when MME receives a Delete Bearer Request message with cause code #4 (RAT changed from 3GPP to Non-3GPP) and the PDN Deactivation procedure is successful.

EntityDef.name: VS.SM.DelPGWInitPDNCC4Att.E
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of attempted PGW-initiated PDN Deactivations due to change from LTE to non-3GPP access. This counter is increased when MME receives a Delete Bearer Request message with cause code #4 (RAT changed from 3GPP to Non-3GPP).

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_GTPUserPlane_E
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types related to the GTP User Plane area for LTE.

EntityDef.name: GTP.OutDataPktS11
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #GTP# data #PDU#s which have been generated by the #GTP# protocol entity on the S11 interface.

EntityDef.name: GTP.OutDataOctS11
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets in outgoing #GTP# data packets on the S11 interface.

EntityDef.name: GTP.InDataOctS11
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets in incoming #GTP# data packets on the S11 interface.

EntityDef.name: GTP.InDataPktS11
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #GTP# data #PDU#s which have been accepted and processed by the #GTP# entity on the S11 interface.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_IP_IPInterface
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the IP_IPInterface area. The measurements only apply to IPv4 packets.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsHCOutBcastPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of broadcast IPv4 datagrams transmitted from the interface.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsInUnknownProtos
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv4 datagrams discarded on the interface because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsHCInOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets in IPv4 datagrams received on the interface, including those received in error. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipIfStatsHCInReceives measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsHCInMcastPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of received multicast IPv4 datagrams on the interface.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsInDiscards
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv4 datagrams received on the interface without any error but discarded because of internal reasons. The causes, for example, can be lack of resources, packet filtering denying the IPv4 datagrams, or content-based forwarding denying the IPv4 datagrams.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsInTruncatedPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv4 datagrams discarded on the interface for not carrying enough data.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsInAddrErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv4 datagrams discarded on the interface because their destination IPv4 addresses are invalid to the SGSN-MME. The applicable scenarios include the following: - The destination IPv4 address is not a local interface address. - The destination IPv4 address is not an SGSN-MME service address. - The destination IPv4 address has an unsupported value.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsHCOutMcastPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of multicast IPv4 datagrams transmitted from the interface.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsOutDiscards
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of output IPv4 datagrams discarded with no problems preventing their transmission to the destination. The reason why the IPv4 datagrams are discarded can be the lack of buffer space.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsHCOutTransmits
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv4 datagrams supplied to the lower layers for transmission over the interface.
This measurement counts IPv4 packets that include payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsHCOutOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets in IPv4 datagrams supplied to the lower layers for transmission over the interface. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipIfStatsHCOutTransmits measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsHCInReceives
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of input IPv4 datagrams received on the interface, including those received in error.
This measurement counts IPv4 packets that include payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsHCOutRequests
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv4 datagrams that local IP user protocols (including ICMP) have supplied to IP in requests for transmission.
This measurement is not used for payload traffic and is only applicable for LC originated traffic, for example, the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsHCInForwDatagrams
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv4 datagrams the LC received on the indexed IP interface and attempted to forward to the final destination.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsHCInDelivers
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv4 datagrams received on the interface and successfully delivered to user-protocols (including ICMP) on this entity.
This measurement is not used for payload traffic and is only applicable for traffic terminated on the LCs.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsHCInBcastPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of broadcast IPv4 datagrams received on the interface.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsHCOutForwDatagrams
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of IPv4 datagrams the LC received and successfully forwarded through the indexed IP interface to the next hop toward the final destination.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsHCInMcastOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets received in multicast IPv4 datagrams on the interface. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipIfStatsHCInMcastPkts measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsInHdrErrors
EntityDef.description: The measurement provides the number of input IPv4 datagrams discarded on the interface because of errors in their IP headers. The errors, for example, can be version number mismatch, exceeded hop count, and other format errors.

EntityDef.name: ipIfStatsHCOutMcastOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets transmitted in the multicast IPv4 datagrams from the interface. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipIfStatsHCOutMcastPkts measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_IPv6_IPInterface
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the IPv6_IPInterface area. The measurements only apply to IPv6 packets.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsHCOutRequests
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv6 datagrams that local IP user-protocols (including ICMP) supplied to IP in requests for transmission.
This measurement is not used for payload traffic and is only applicable for LC originated traffic, for example, the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsHCOutMcastPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of multicast IPv6 datagrams transmitted from the interface.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsInDiscards
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv6 datagrams received on the interface without any error but discarded because of internal reasons. The causes, for example, can be lack of resources, packet filtering denying the IPv6 datagrams, or content-based forwarding denying the IPv6 datagrams.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsHCInReceives
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of input IPv6 datagrams received on the interface, including those received in error.
This measurement counts IPv6 packets that include payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsInUnknownProtos
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv6 datagrams discarded on the interface due to an unknown or unsupported protocol.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsInTruncatedPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv6 datagrams discarded on the interface for not carrying enough data.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsHCOutTransmits
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv6 datagrams supplied to the lower layers for transmission over the interface.
This measurement counts IPv6 packets that include payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsOutDiscards
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of output IPv6 datagrams discarded with no problems preventing their transmission to the destination. The reason why the IPv6 datagrams are discarded can be the lack of buffer space.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsHCOutOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets in IPv6 datagrams supplied to the lower layers for transmission over the interface. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipv6IfStatsHCOutTransmits measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsHCOutMcastOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets transmitted in multicast IPv6 datagrams from the interface. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipv6IfStatsHCOutMcastPkts measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsHCInMcastPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of multicast IPv6 datagrams received on the interface.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsHCInDelivers
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv6 datagrams received on the interface and successfully delivered to user-protocols (including ICMP).
This measurement is not used for payload traffic and is only applicable for traffic terminated on the LCs.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsInHdrErrors
EntityDef.description: The measurement provides the number of input IPv6 datagrams discarded on the interface because of errors in their IP headers. The errors, for example, can be version number mismatch, exceeded hop count, and other format errors.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsInAddrErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv6 datagrams discarded on the interface because their destination IPv6 addresses are invalid to the SGSN-MME. The applicable scenarios include the the following: - The destination IPv6 address is not a local interface address. - The destination IPv6 address is not an SGSN-MME service address. - The destination IPv6 address has an unsupported value.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsHCOutForwDatagrams
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of IPv6 datagrams the LC received and successfully forwarded through the indexed IP interface to the next hop toward the final destination.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsHCInOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets in IPv6 datagrams received on the interface, including those received in error. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipv6IfStatsHCInReceives measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsHCInMcastOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets received in multicast IPv6 datagrams on the interface. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipv6IfStatsHCInMcastPkts measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: ipv6IfStatsHCInForwDatagrams
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv6 datagrams the LC received on the indexed IP interface and attempted to forward to the final destination.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_IP
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the IP area.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsOutNoRoutes
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv4 datagrams discarded on all the logical networks as no route is found to transmit them.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsFragCreates
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv4 fragments generated as a result of fragmentation in the SGSN-MME. This measurement includes the IPv4 fragments counted by all ipStatsFragCreates instances.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsHCOutMcastOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number octets transmitted in multicast IPv4 datagrams from all interfaces. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipSystemStatsHCOutMcastPkts measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsHCInOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets in IPv4 datagrams received on all interfaces, including those received in error. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipSystemStatsHCInReceives measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsFragFails
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv4 datagrams discarded because they needed to but could not be fragmented in the SGSN-MME. The cause, for example, can be the Don't Fragment flag was set in the IP header. This measurement includes IPv4 datagrams counted by all ipStatsFragFails instances.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsHCInDelivers
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of IPv4 datagrams received on all interfaces and successfully delivered to IPv4 user-protocols (including ICMP).
This measurement is not used for payload traffic and is only applicable for traffic terminated on the LCs.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsReasmOKs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of IPv4 datagrams successfully reassembled in the SGSN-MME. This measurement includes IPv4 datagrams counted by all ipStatsReasmOKs instances.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsHCOutMcastPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of multicast IPv4 datagrams transmitted from all interfaces.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsHCOutOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of octets in IPv4 datagrams supplied to the lower layers for transmission for all interfaces. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipSystemStatsHCOutTransmits measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsHCInBcastPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of broadcast IPv4 datagrams received on all interfaces.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsInAddrErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv4 datagrams discarded on all interfaces because of invalid IP address in the IP header destination field.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsInUnknownProtos
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv4 datagrams discarded on all interfaces due to an unknown or unsupported protocol.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsOutDiscards
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of valid output IPv4 datagrams dropped due to lack of resources. There can be a lack of resources when packet queues are full, or when the driver is out of buffers.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsHCInMcastOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets received in multicast IPv4 datagrams on all interfaces. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipSystemStatsHCInMcastPkts measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsInHdrErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv4 datagrams discarded on all interfaces due to invalid IP header. The invalidity includes version number mismatch, other format errors, and the like.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsInTruncatedPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv4 datagrams discarded on all interfaces for not carrying enough data.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsHCInMcastPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of multicast IPv4 datagrams received on all interfaces.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsFragOKs
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv4 datagrams successfully fragmented in the SGSN-MME. This measurement includes IPv4 datagrams counted by all ipStatsFragOKs instances.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsReasmReqds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of IPv4 fragments received and that need to be reassembled in the SGSN-MME. This measurement includes IPv4 fragments counted by all ipStatsReasmReqds instances.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsReasmFails
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of IPv4 fragments that have not been reassembled in the SGSN-MME. This measurement includes the IPv4 fragments counted by all ipStatsReasmFails instances.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsHCOutBcastPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of broadcast IPv4 datagrams transmitted from all interfaces.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsHCOutRequests
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of IPv4 datagrams that local IP user-protocols (including ICMP) have supplied to the IP in requests for transmission. This measurement includes IPv4 datagrams counted by all ipIfStatsHCOutRequests instances.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsHCOutTransmits
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of IPv4 datagrams supplied to the lower layers for transmission. This measurement includes IPv4 datagrams counted by all ipIfStatsHCOutTransmits instances.

EntityDef.name: ipSystemStatsHCInReceives
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of input IPv4 datagrams received on all interfaces, including those received in error.
This measurement counts IPv4 packets that include payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_IP_PIU_IPNetwork
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the IP_PIU_IPNetwork area. The measurements only apply to IPv4 packets.

EntityDef.name: ipStatsReasmOKs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of IPv4 datagrams successfully reassembled in the indexed logical network on the PIU or VM.

EntityDef.name: ipStatsForwTableEntries
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv4 routes currently in the forwarding table.
The SGSN-MME has the following limits on route numbers: - The SMXB supports a maximum of 40,000 IPv4 routes in the forwarding table of each LC. - The SMXB has no limit on the number of IPv4 routes in the forwarding table of each IP network. - Virtual SGSN-MME supports a maximum of 256 static IPv4 routes per vLC and VPN. - Virtual SGSN-MME supports a maximum of 1,024 static IPv4 routes per vLC. Exceeding these limits causes loss of connectivity.
Do the following when the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: - Reduce the number of static routes configured on the SGSN-MME. - Reduce the number of routes exported to the SGSN-MME from external routers. - If OSPF is used, consider using OSPF NSSA to reduce the number of routes.
Note: When this measurement is used on virtual SGSN-MME, the default alarm-triggering level is 250 and the default alarm-clearing level is 240.

EntityDef.name: ipStatsFragFails
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv4 datagrams discarded because they could not be fragmented in the indexed logical network on the PIU or VM. The cause, for example, can be that the Don't Fragment flag was set in the IP header.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipStatsFragCreates
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv4 fragments generated as a result of fragmentation in the indexed logical network on the PIU or VM.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipStatsFragOKs
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv4 datagrams successfully fragmented in the indexed logical network on the PIU or VM.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipStatsReasmFails
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of failures detected by the IP reassembly algorithm for each logical network on the PIU or VM. Failures can be, for example, reassembly time-out errors.
The counter value is calculated as follows: (number of IPv4 packet fragments received) - (number of fragments in successfully reassembled IPv4 packets). The counter is updated when an IPv4 packet is successfully reassembled, if the newly calculated value is higher than the current counter value. During the time between two successfully reassembled IPv4 packets, the counter can show an inaccurate value.

EntityDef.name: ipStatsOutNoRoutes
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv4 datagrams discarded on the indexed logical network as no route is found to transmit them.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipStatsReasmReqds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of IPv4 fragments received and that need to be reassembled in the indexed logical network on the PIU or VM.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_IPv6_PIU_IPNetwork
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the IPv6_PIU_IPNetwork area. The measurements only apply to IPv6 packets.

EntityDef.name: ipv6StatsFragFails
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv6 datagrams discarded because they could not be fragmented in the indexed logical network on the PIU.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipv6StatsReasmOKs
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of IPv6 datagrams successfully reassembled in the indexed logical network on the PIU.

EntityDef.name: ipv6StatsFragOKs
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv6 datagrams successfully fragmented in the indexed logical network on the PIU.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipv6StatsFragCreates
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv6 fragments generated as a result of fragmentation in the indexed logical network on the PIU.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipv6StatsReasmReqds
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of IPv6 fragments received and that need to be reassembled in the indexed logical network on the PIU.

EntityDef.name: ipv6StatsReasmFails
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of failures detected by the IP reassembly algorithm in the indexed logical network on the PIU. The failures, for example, can be reassembly time-out errors.
This measurement is not necessarily a count of the discarded IPv6 datagrams on the PIU.

EntityDef.name: ipv6StatsForwTableEntries
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv6 routes currently in the forwarding table.
The SGSN-MME has the following limits on route numbers: - The SMXB supports a maximum of 8,000 IPv6 routes in the forwarding table of each LC. - The SMXB has no limit on the number of IPv6 routes in the forwarding table of each IP network. - Virtual SGSN-MME supports a maximum of 256 static IPv6 routes per vLC and VPN. - Virtual SGSN-MME supports a maximum of 1,024 static IPv6 routers per vLC. Exceeding these limits causes loss of connectivity.
Do the following when the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: - Reduce the number of static routes configured on the SGSN-MME. - Reduce the number of routes exported to the SGSN-MME from external routers.
Note: When this measurement is used on virtual SGSN-MME, the default alarm-triggering level is 250 and the default alarm-clearing level is 240.

EntityDef.name: ipv6StatsOutNoRoutes
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv6 datagrams discarded on the indexed logical network as no route is found to transmit them.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_IPv6
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the IP area.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsFragFails
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv6 datagrams discarded because they needed to but could not be fragmented in the SGSN-MME. This measurement includes IPv6 datagrams counted by all ipv6StatsFragFails instances.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsOutNoRoutes
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv6 datagrams discarded on all the logical networks as no route is found to transmit them.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsInDiscards
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of valid IPv6 datagrams discarded on all interfaces due to lack of resources or denied by content based forwarding.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsInHdrErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv6 datagrams discarded on all interfaces due to invalid IP header. The invalidity includes version number mismatch, other format errors, and the like.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsReasmReqds
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv6 fragments received and that need to be reassembled in the SGSN-MME.
This measurement includes IPv6 fragments counted by all ipv6StatsReasmReqds instances.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsHCInOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets in IPv6 datagrams received on all interfaces, including those received in error. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipv6SystemStatsHCInReceives measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsInAddrErrors
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv6 datagrams discarded on all interfaces because of invalid IP address in the IP header destination field.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsReasmFails
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of failures detected by the IP reassembly algorithm in the SGSN-MME. The failures, for example, can be reassembly time-out errors.
This measurement includes the failures counted by all ipv6StatsReasmFails instances.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsReasmOKs
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv6 datagrams successfully reassembled in the SGSN-MME.
This measurement includes IPv6 datagrams counted by all ipv6StatsReasmOKs instances.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsInUnknownProtos
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv6 datagrams discarded on all interfaces due to an unknown or unsupported protocol.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsHCOutMcastOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number octets transmitted in multicast IPv6 datagrams from all interfaces. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipv6SystemStatsHCOutMcastPkts measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsHCInMcastPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of multicast IPv6 datagrams received on all interfaces.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsFragOKs
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv6 datagrams successfully fragmented in the SGSN-MME. This measurement includes IPv6 datagrams counted by all ipv6StatsFragOKs instances.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsHCOutTransmits
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of IPv6 datagrams supplied to the lower layers for transmission.
This measurement includes IPv6 datagrams counted by all ipv6IfStatsHCOutTransmits instances.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsHCInDelivers
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of IPv6 datagrams received on all interfaces and successfully delivered to IPv6 user-protocols (including ICMP).
This measurement is not used for payload traffic and is only applicable for traffic terminated on the LCs.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsHCOutOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of octets in IPv6 datagrams supplied to the lower layers for transmission for all interfaces. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipv6SystemStatsHCOutTransmits measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsHCInMcastOctets
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of octets received in multicast IPv6 datagrams on all interfaces. Octets from datagrams counted in the ipv6SystemStatsHCInMcastPkts measurement are counted here.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsHCInReceives
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of input IPv6 datagrams received on all interfaces, including those received in error.
This measurement counts IPv6 packets that include payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsHCOutMcastPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of multicast IPv6 datagrams transmitted from all interfaces.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsFragCreates
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of IPv6 fragments generated as a result of fragmentation in the SGSN-MME. This measurement includes the IPv6 fragments counted by all ipv6StatsFragCreates instances.
This measurement counts payload, signalling, and the control packets of IP routing protocols.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsHCOutRequests
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of IPv6 datagrams that local IP user-protocols (including ICMP) have supplied to the IP in requests for transmission.
This measurement includes IPv6 datagrams counted by all ipv6IfStatsHCOutRequests instances.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsInTruncatedPkts
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of input IPv6 datagrams discarded on all interfaces for not carrying enough data.

EntityDef.name: ipv6SystemStatsOutDiscards
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of valid output IPv6 datagrams dropped due to lack of resources. There can be a lack of resources when packet queues are full, or when the driver is out of buffers.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_OSPFv3Area
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the OSPFv3Area area.

EntityDef.name: ospfv3AreaBdrRtrCount
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of area border routers reachable within this area. This number is initially zero, and is calculated in each #SPF# pass.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: This gauge can only increase as a result of network reconfiguration. No actions are recommended.

EntityDef.name: ospfv3AreaScopeLsaCount
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of #LSA#s in the link-state database of this area, excluding #AS# external #LSA#s.
If #OSPF# #NSSA# is used within the area, this counter also includes Type 7 #LSA#s. In this case, it is possible that the supervised threshold needs to be increased.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: Investigate why that many #LSA#s exist. It is possible that the network needs to be redesigned. Consider using #OSPF# #NSSA# to reduce the number of #LSA#s.

EntityDef.name: ospfv3AreaSpfRuns
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of times that the intra-area route table is calculated using the link-state database of this area. This is typically done using Dijkstra's algorithm.

EntityDef.name: ospfv3AreaAsBdrRtrCount
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the total number of #AS# border routers reachable within this area. This number is initially zero, and is calculated in each #SPF# pass.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: This gauge can only increase as a result of network reconfiguration. No actions are recommended.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_OSPFv3Interface
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the OSPFv3Interface area.

EntityDef.name: ospfv3IfLinkScopeLsaCount
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of Link-scope #LSA#s in the link-state database of the link.

EntityDef.name: ospfv3IfEvents
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of times the #OSPFv3# interface has changed state, or an error has occurred.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_OSPFv3Neighbour
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the OSPFv3Neighbour area.

EntityDef.name: ospfv3NbrEvents
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of times this neighbor relationship has changed state, or an error has occurred.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_OSPFv3Network
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the OSPFv3Network area.

EntityDef.name: ospfv3RxNewLsas
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #LSAs# received determined to be new instantiations. This number does not include newer instantiations of self-originated #LSA#s.

EntityDef.name: ospfv3AsScopeLsaCount
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #AS#-scope #LSA#s, such as AS external #LSA#s, in the link-state database.

EntityDef.name: ospfv3OriginateNewLsas
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of new #LSAs# that are originated. The counter is incremented each time the router originates a new #LSA#.

EntityDef.name: ospfv3ExtLsaCount
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of external (LS type 5) #LSA#s in the link-state database. The #SGSN-MME# supports a maximum of 8000 #LSA#s. Exceeding this limit can put the network at the risk because each new #LSA# makes #OSPF# convergence slower.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: Investigate why so many external #LSA#s exist and which entity in the network that announces them. It is possible that the network needs to be redesigned. If #OSPF# #NSSA# is not used within the area, consider using it to reduce the number of external #LSA#s.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_BgpNeighbor
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the BgpNeighbor area.

EntityDef.name: bgpNeighborOutTotalMessages
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of BGP messages transmitted to the remote peer on this connection.

EntityDef.name: bgpNeighborInTotalMessages
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of BGP messages received from the remote peer on this connection.

EntityDef.name: bgpNeighborInUpdateElapsedTime
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the elapsed time, in seconds, since the last #BGP# UPDATE message was received from the neighbor. Each time the bgpNeighborInUpdates counter is incremented the value of this object is set to zero.
Action to be taken if the measurement exceeds its supervised threshold: A network failure might have occured in the network. Investigate if there are any problems with the #IP# connectivity at the interface board.

EntityDef.name: bgpNeighborOutUpdates
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #BGP# UPDATE messages transmitted on this connection.

EntityDef.name: bgpNeighborInUpdates
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the number of #BGP# UPDATE messages received on this connection.

EntityDef.name: bgpNeighborFsmEstablishedTransitions
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of times the #BGP# #FSM# is transitioned into the established state.

EntityDef.name: SGSN-MME_M2M_G
EntityDef.description: This PmGroup defines measurement types within the M2M_G area

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.PagingEdrxUeAtt.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of attempted paging procedures initiated for the UEs with Extended Idle Mode Discontinuous Reception (eDRX) mode activated. The counter is incremented when an eDRX Paging PS message is sent to the BSC. That is at the transmission of the first eDRX Paging PS message and retransmission is not counted.

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.PagingEcUeAtt.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of attempted Paging procedures initiated for Extended Coverage (EC)-GSM IoT mode UEs. The counter is incremented when the first Paging message is sent. Retransmissions of the same Paging message are not counted.

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.NbrAttachedEcUe.G
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of currently attached Extended Coverage (EC)-GSM IoT mode UEs. The gauge is incremented when an EC-GSM IoT mode UE sets the Coverage Class, for example during attach. The gauge is decremented when an EC-GSM IoT mode is detached or no longer has a Coverage Class set.
#Note: After a change to the #SAU# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #SAU# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 90% of the SAU capacity license limit
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 85% of the SAU capacity license limit

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.NbrAttachedEdrxUe.G
EntityDef.description:
This measurement provides the number of currently attached UEs using Extended Idle Mode Discontinuous Reception (eDRX). The gauge is incremented when a UE using eDRX attaches to or moves into SGSN. The gauge is decremented when a UE detaches from or moves out of SGSN, or deactivates eDRX.
#Note: After a change to the #SAU# capacity license value, a small restart must be performed to update the default alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels. Manually configured alarm-triggering and alarm-clearing levels are not updated by a small restart. After a #SAU# capacity license value change, manually configured levels can be updated only by using the set_pm_sup CLI command.Note#
EntityDef.alarmRaiseDefaultLevel: value of 90% of the SAU capacity license limit
EntityDef.alarmClearDefaultLevel: value of 85% of the SAU capacity license limit

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.PagingEdrxUeSucc.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of successful Paging procedures initiated for the UEs using Extended Idle Mode Discontinuous Reception (eDRX), irrespective of the Paging being an initial eDRX Paging PS message or the resending of the eDRX Paging PS message. The counter is incremented when any valid LLC frame is received from the UE.

EntityDef.name: VS.M2M.PagingEcUeSucc.G
EntityDef.description: This measurement provides the total number of successful Paging procedures initiated for Extended Coverage (EC)-GSM IoT mode UEs.
